analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ming gang dang gang dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi chos gang dang gang dag brjod pa'i chos de la ming de yod pa ma yin pa de ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: â€œWhatever names there are for whatever dependent phenomena there are, those names do not exist in those phenomena. That is the reality of phenomena.â€ğŸ”½Thus it is said:

original: des ni / brtags pa'i dngos po med pa nyid //
analyzed: des ni / brtags pa'i dngos po med pa nyid //

original: de bzhin du /ğŸ”½bskyed bya med cing skyes pa med //
analyzed: de bzhin du / bskyed bya med cing skyes pa med //
translated: Similarly,ğŸ”½There is nothing produced and nothing that produces,

original: rkyen rnams dag ni gang dag kyang //
analyzed: rkyen rnams dag ni gang dag kyang //

original: 'ga' yang gar na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gar na'ang yod ma yin //

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba rkyen gzhan gyis da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bskyed par bya ba dang / 'das pa'i dus su bskyed zin pa yang med la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba rkyen gzhan gyis da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bskyed par bya ba dang / 'das pa'i dus su bskyed zin pa yang med la /
translated: This passage from the noble Descent into Laá¹…kÄ SÅ«tra says that the so-called dependent nature is not something to be produced in the present or future by other conditions, nor is it something already produced in the past.ğŸ”½And the conditions do not exist anywhere at all.

original: rkyen rnams kyang 'ga' yang gnas skabs gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba don dam par ni @283a * //ğŸ”½yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyang 'ga' yang gnas skabs gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba don dam par ni @283a * // yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus it teaches that the so-called dependent nature does not exist ultimately.

original: tha snyad du ni yod par brjod par bya'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni yod par brjod par bya'o zhes bstan te /
translated: But it is to be expressed conventionally.

original: des ni gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa yin //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa yin //
translated: This teaches that the other-dependent also does not exist ultimately, but it is explained that it does exist conventionally, like an illusion or a dream.

original: zhes gsungs pas gzhan gyi dbang yang don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi tha snyad du sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid du bshad pa'i khungs gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas gzhan gyi dbang yang don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi tha snyad du sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid du bshad pa'i khungs gzhan bstan to //
translated: Now, in order to teach another source that the Madhyamikas are free from the fault stated in the lines:

original: da ni / sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i mtha' //ğŸ”½rtog par byed pa nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: da ni / sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i mtha' // rtog par byed pa nyams par 'gyur //
translated: â€œThe extremes of superimposition and deprecationğŸ”½Are destroyed by the conceptualization of existence and nonexistence,â€

original: zhes bya ba'i skyon dbu ma pa la med pa'i khungs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skyon dbu ma pa la med pa'i khungs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says:

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: gang la cung zad skye med cing //
analyzed: gang la cung zad skye med cing //

original: 'gag pa'ang cung zad yod min pa //
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang cung zad yod min pa //

analyzed: 'gro ba dben mthong de la ni ;
translated: seeing the world as void,

analyzed: / yod pa nyid dang med nyid med // ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: de'i don ni skye ba yod na sgro 'dogs par 'gyur la 'gag pa yod na skur ba 'debs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The meaning of that is: if arising existed, there would be superimposition; if cessation existed, there would be denial.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang la cung zad skye ba yang med cing 'gag pa yang cung zad yod pa ma yin pa 'gro ba mtha' gnyis dben par mthong ba de la ni yod pa nyid kyang med la med pa nyid kyang med par sgro 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang la cung zad skye ba yang med cing 'gag pa yang cung zad yod pa ma yin pa 'gro ba mtha' gnyis dben par mthong ba de la ni yod pa nyid kyang med la med pa nyid kyang med par sgro 'dogs pa dang /
translated: For the yogi for whom nothing whatsoever arises and nothing whatsoever ceases, who sees the world as free from the two extremes, there is neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //ğŸ”½de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhir gyur pa /
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no // de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhir gyur pa /
translated: Because he does not conceive the extremes of superimposition and denial, he does not fall into error.

original: don dam par yod par brtags pa de mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: don dam par yod par brtags pa de mi 'thad cing /
translated: Thus the YogÄcÄra assertion that the dependent nature, the basis of both affliction and purification, exists ultimately is untenable.

analyzed: dbu ma pa don dam par skye ba med par smra ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skur ba 'debs pa ma yin no // khyed cag chos kyi khams ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar ston ces pa ni yang gzhan yang dbu ma pas rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The Madhyamikas who say that ultimately there is no arising do not deprecate the afflictions and purification.ğŸ”½You should explain how the dharmadhatu becomes afflicted and purified.

original: rnam par byang ba'i gzhir 'gyur bar 'dod pa de ji ltar de ltar 'gyur bar ston ces dri par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i gzhir 'gyur bar 'dod pa de ji ltar de ltar 'gyur bar ston ces dri par bya ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the Madhyamikas should ask the Yogacaras, â€œHow does the dependent nature, which you assert to be the basis of affliction and purification, become the basis of affliction and purification?â€

original: de'i lan du rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de'i lan du rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'di skad ces /

analyzed: chu khams @283b gser dang nam mkha' dag / dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod // ces zer te /
translated: The element of water, gold, and space are asserted to be pure like the purification of water.

original: dper na chu'i khams rnyog pa can sman dang phrad na dag par 'gyur ba dang / gser dri ma can bzhu ba la sogs pas dag par 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha' du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / na bun dang /
analyzed: dper na chu'i khams rnyog pa can sman dang phrad na dag par 'gyur ba dang / gser dri ma can bzhu ba la sogs pas dag par 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha' du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / na bun dang /
translated: For example, the element of water that is turbid becomes pure when it encounters medicine. Gold that is impure becomes pure through smelting and so on. Space is pure when it is free from the stains of smoke, dust, mist, fog,ğŸ”½clouds and so on.

original: sprin la sogs pa dri ma can de dag dang bral bas dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos kyi khams kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur zhing de dang bral bas rnam par byang barğŸ”½'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sprin la sogs pa dri ma can de dag dang bral bas dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos kyi khams kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur zhing de dang bral bas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, the element of Dharma is naturally pure, but it becomes afflicted through the afflictions that are adventitious and it becomes purified when it is free from them.

analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //

original: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //

analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //

analyzed: nyon mongs glo bur yin phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa glo bur ba yin pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ma yin zhing dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: And because the afflictions are adventitious, it is not unafflicted and is not pure.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

translated: Because even the proponents of a selfğŸ”½say:

If the pure self were not the self,

analyzed: pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //

original: de phyir re zhig bdag brtag pa byed pa med pa yod de /
analyzed: de phyir re zhig bdag brtag pa byed pa med pa yod de /
translated: Therefore, the self is not an object of refutation by reasons,ğŸ”½because it is possible to refute the opponent by saying, â€œAlthough the self does not exist as an object of refutation by reasons,

analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba dang thar pa dag kyang yod do zhes de ltar phyir zlog par byed nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: samsara and nirvana exist.â€ğŸ”½Since proponents of the self are able to prove that samsara and nirvana exist even though the self does not exist as an object of refutation by reasons,

analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag tu smra ba dag gis kyang bdag brtag pa byed pa med pa yod kyang 'khor ba dang / thar pa dag yod par sgrub nus pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag la yang chos kyi khams zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin par 'grub pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag gi tshig de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: the YogÄcÄraâ€™s statement that the meaning of the term â€œthe element of phenomenaâ€ is the entity of the self is illogical.

original: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon sba ba'i thabs 'thad pa med pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya bas ni de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' chos kyi khams zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don brtag pa khas blangs pa de'i
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon sba ba'i thabs 'thad pa med pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya bas ni de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' chos kyi khams zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don brtag pa khas blangs pa de'i
translated: This is because the YogÄcÄras assert that the meaning of the term â€œthe element of phenomenaâ€ is their tenets.

original: skyon 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyon 'di lta ste /
translated: The faults of that are as follows.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de sba ba'i thabs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de sba ba'i thabs 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
translated: If it were not afflicted,

original: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
translated: all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
translated: If it were not pure,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
translated: effort would be fruitless.

original: nyon mongs ma yin mi mongs min //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma yin mi mongs min //
translated: It is not afflicted and is not unafflicted,

original: de ni dag min ma dag min //
analyzed: de ni dag min ma dag min //
translated: it is not pure and is not impure.

original: sems ni rang bzhin 'od gsal phyir //
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin 'od gsal phyir //

analyzed: nyon mongs glo bur yin phyir ro //

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'thad pa med pa de dag mi 'grub ste /

analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po med pas dngos po ni brjod par bya ba nyid yin te /

translated: Because you say that both the afflicted and the pure are inexpressible, this is a contradictory refutation.

analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can yin na ni ji ltar rnam par dag pa yin /

analyzed: gal te rnam par dag pa yin na ni ji ltar nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur bas de mi 'grub po //
translated: If it is pure, then how could it be afflicted? Therefore, that is not established.

analyzed: yang gzhan yang gal te nyon mongs pa can ma yin na ni des na byis pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not afflicted.

analyzed: ji ste kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar 'dod na ni 'o na nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: But if you assert that they are afflicted, then it is not not afflicted.

original: de bzhin du gal te dag pa yin na yang de'i phyir yang ji zhig dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te dag pa yin na yang de'i phyir yang ji zhig dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, if it is pure, then what is purified?

original: dag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is already pure.

original: ji ste dag par 'gyur bar 'dod na ni dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir de mi 'grub @284b po ;ğŸ”½/ gzhan yang chu la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du tha snyad pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos por skye ba la ltos pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: ji ste dag par 'gyur bar 'dod na ni dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir de mi 'grub @284b po ; / gzhan yang chu la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du tha snyad pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos por skye ba la ltos pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
translated: If you assert that it becomes pure, it is not established because it is not pure.ğŸ”½Moreover, just as water and so on arise due to the power of causes and conditions, conventional consciousness arises as afflicted or unafflicted things in dependence on conditions.ğŸ”½Therefore it is possible that afflicted states arise simultaneously with unmistaken consciousness and that afflicted states arise simultaneously with unmistaken consciousness without afflicted states.

original: lhan cig skye ba dang nyon mongs pa rnams med par phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bar rung ba de ltar chos kyi khams ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba dang nyon mongs pa rnams med par phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bar rung ba de ltar chos kyi khams ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
translated: Thus the phenomena element is not established as either afflicted or purified.

original: shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin pas chu la sogs pa bzhin du de bzhin nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bar mi rigs so zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi dpe /
analyzed: shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin pas chu la sogs pa bzhin du de bzhin nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bar mi rigs so zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi dpe /
translated: is not established:

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' dag / dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' dag / dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: â€œJust as water, gold, and space are considered pure,

original: ces bya ba de mi 'grub par ston te /ğŸ”½'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pa la yang tha snyad du chu dang / gser dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis dag pa dang ma dag par skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du tha snyad pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba de mi 'grub par ston te / 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pa la yang tha snyad du chu dang / gser dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis dag pa dang ma dag par skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du tha snyad pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang /
translated: so the mind is considered pure.â€ğŸ”½For us Followers of the Middle Way, it is tenable that the mind is thoroughly afflicted or completely purified in dependence upon the afflictions arising as things that are either afflicted or unafflicted in the consciousness of the worldly relative.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos por skye ba la ltos pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / lhan cig skye ba ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rung la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos por skye ba la ltos pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / lhan cig skye ba ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rung la /
translated: This is because, conventionally, we Followers of the Middle Way do not refute the arising of things such as water, gold, and space, which arise through the power of causes and conditions and are characterized as pure or impure.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams med par phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rung ba de ltar khyed kyi chos kyi khams ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang / shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin pas khyed kyi dpe chu dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams med par phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rung ba de ltar khyed kyi chos kyi khams ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang / shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin pas khyed kyi dpe chu dang /
translated: Since the phenomena element of your system is not simultaneously generated with afflictions and unmistaken consciousness, it is not suitable to be purified.ğŸ”½Thus your example of water, gold, and space, which are purified or not purified by the power of causes and conditions, is not tenable.

original: gser dang / nam mkha' dag rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis dag pa dang ma dag pa'i skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du khyed kyi dpes bsgrub pa'i dngos po de bzhin nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bas mi rigs pasğŸ”½khyed kyi dpe ma grub ste /
analyzed: gser dang / nam mkha' dag rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis dag pa dang ma dag pa'i skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du khyed kyi dpes bsgrub pa'i dngos po de bzhin nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bas mi rigs pas khyed kyi dpe ma grub ste /
translated: The example of your system is not established because the nature of things established by your example would be thoroughly afflicted and completely purified.

original: 'di ltar dpe dang / dngos gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dpe dang / dngos gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the example and the meaning are not similar.

original: gal te du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa nam mkha' dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re dpe ji skadğŸ”½smos pa de bzhin du dngos po chos kyi khams kyang de @285a * //
analyzed: gal te du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa nam mkha' dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re dpe ji skad smos pa de bzhin du dngos po chos kyi khams kyang de @285a * //
translated: But isnâ€™t it said that smoke, mist, etc. exist and that space with and without stains does not exist?

original: bzhin pas dpe dang dngos su mthun no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bzhin pas dpe dang dngos su mthun no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Yogacaras say that just as the example is stated, so too is the entity, the element of dharmas.ğŸ”½Thus the example and the entity are similar.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Space does not exist as a substance because it is refuted as a substance.

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha' de las snam bu'i rdzas dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med par 'gyur ba lta bu'i rdzas nges par gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha' de las snam bu'i rdzas dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med par 'gyur ba lta bu'i rdzas nges par gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because space does not definitely abide as a substance from which a cloth with stains and without stains arises.

original: nam mkha'i du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa na yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa na yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Smoke and mist, etc. in the sky are not described as either existent or nonexistent, nor as either pure or impure.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa dag mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa dag mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if they did exist substantially, they could not be established as either pure or impure.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dper na chos kyi khams bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dper na chos kyi khams bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: If space existed substantially, it would not be tenable to posit it as an element, because it would not be a basis for the qualities of arising, enduring, and disintegrating, like the element of mental objects.

original: pha rol po dag gi dper mi rung bar bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi dper mi rung bar bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This is the statement of an inference that proves that space is not a suitable example for the opponent.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are to be connected in order.

original: dper na chos kyi khams ni kun rdzob tu rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na chos kyi khams ni kun rdzob tu rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the element of mental objects exists substantially in a conventional sense, but ultimately it does not arise or disintegrate.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa dag mi 'grub pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang kun rdzob tu rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa dag mi 'grub pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang kun rdzob tu rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as it is not established that space is either contaminated or uncontaminated,ğŸ”½in the same way, even though space exists as a substance conventionally, ultimately it is not produced or destroyed.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa dag tu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa dag tu mi 'grub bo //
translated: Just as the stained and stainless are not established, so too space is not established as stained or stainless, because it is not ultimately produced or destroyed.ğŸ”½Or else, just as space is stained and stainless, so too the phenomena element is designated as afflicted and purified.

original: yang na nam mkha' dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med par 'gyur ba bzhin du chos kyi khams la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag nye bar btags pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bya bas ni nye bar btags pa yin pas khyod don dam pa pa yin par 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med par 'gyur ba bzhin du chos kyi khams la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag nye bar btags pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bya bas ni nye bar btags pa yin pas khyod don dam pa pa yin par 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus the meaning that you accept is undermined.

original: kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the observation of affliction,

original: zhes bya ba de la yang dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la yang dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that regard, the fault of the thesis and the reason are the same as before.

original: sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa'i gtan tshigs su kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de la yang ji ltar sngar /
analyzed: sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa'i gtan tshigs su kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de la yang ji ltar sngar /
translated: But in that case, the meaning of the reason is not established, because, as was said earlier,ğŸ”½â€œbecause of the designation and the reason,â€

original: btags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba de yang phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: btags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba de yang phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the reason is not a property of the subject.

original: ji ste yang /
analyzed: ji ste yang /
translated: But if you say,ğŸ”½â€œbecause of the designation and the reason,â€

original: btags pa rgyu mtshan @285b bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dir chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin pas /
analyzed: btags pa rgyu mtshan @285b bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dir chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin pas /
translated: the words of the example in this case are similar to the property.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the inference

original: don dam par gzugs zhes btags pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs zhes btags pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: is that whatever is designated as form in the ultimate

original: rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: is because of the reasonğŸ”½because of the designation.

original: btags pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par byas na yang dper na 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pas /
analyzed: btags pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par byas na yang dper na 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pas /
translated: But because there is no example that is like this,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason is contradictory becauseğŸ”½the reason is stated in general terms.

original: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir dang / chos mthun pa'i dper byas na yang rjes su 'gro ba med pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir dang / chos mthun pa'i dper byas na yang rjes su 'gro ba med pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang /
translated: Just as that is taught, so too, because the afflicted is observed is not the property of the subject, and when a concordant example is cited, the reason is not established because there is no pervasion.

original: don 'gal ba nyid do zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the reason is contradictory, just as before.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag na re gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag na re gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa ste /
translated: Those statements demonstrate that the YogÄcÄra assertion that the dependent nature is the reality of dependent origination of phenomena, the basis of affliction and purification,

original: de ni bden pa gnyi gar yang yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni bden pa gnyi gar yang yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: and that it exists in both truths is untenable.

original: da ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the scriptural passage that states that the lack of reality due to the lack of reality in arising is not tenable,

original: de skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yang ji lta bu yin zhes dri ba smras so //
analyzed: de skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yang ji lta bu yin zhes dri ba smras so //
translated: he asks, â€œHow is it that arising is devoid of reality?â€

original: gal te de rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye zhing rang mi skye ba gang yin pa'o zhen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye zhing rang mi skye ba gang yin pa'o zhen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say, â€œIt is that which arises by the power of conditions, not by itself,â€

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag na re gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni de dang mthun pa'i rkyen gzhan dag gi stobs kyis dbang bya zhing bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag na re gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni de dang mthun pa'i rkyen gzhan dag gi stobs kyis dbang bya zhing bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: the YogÄcÄra say that the dependent nature is that which is to be controlled and generated by the power of other conditions that are compatible with it.

original: rang mi skye bas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //ğŸ”½de skad ces zer ba de la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: rang mi skye bas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no // de skad ces zer ba de la 'di skad ces /
translated: Since it does not arise by itself, it is devoid of reality in arising.

original: de don dam par ji ltar rkyen gyi stobs kyis te /
analyzed: de don dam par ji ltar rkyen gyi stobs kyis te /
translated: To that statement, he says, â€œIn that case, how is it that ultimately it arises by the power of conditions?â€

original: ji ngo bo nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: ji ngo bo nyid kyis sam /
translated: Is it by its own nature?

original: gzhan gyi dngos pos sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos pos sam /
translated: Is it by the nature of another?

original: gnyi gas sam /
analyzed: gnyi gas sam /
translated: Is it by both?

original: ji yod pa las sam /ğŸ”½ji med pa las sam /
analyzed: ji yod pa las sam / ji med pa las sam /
translated: Does it arise from what exists?ğŸ”½Or does it arise from what does not exist?

original: ji yod pa dang med pa las skye'o zhes brjod par bya grang na /
analyzed: ji yod pa dang med pa las skye'o zhes brjod par bya grang na /
translated: Or does it arise from what both exists and does not exist?

original: rnam pa thams cad las kyang sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis de skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad las kyang sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis de skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: But in no way does it arise, as was previously explained.

original: rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ba med pa bstan dka'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ba med pa bstan dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to teach that it arises by the power of conditions.

original: zhes brjod par bya ste /ğŸ”½gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de don dam @286a * //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ste / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de don dam @286a * //
translated: This is what should be said.

original: par rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye na /
analyzed: par rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye na /
translated: If that dependent nature arises by the power of conditions ultimately,

original: rnam pa de dag gcig las skye'o zhes brjod par bya grang na /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gcig las skye'o zhes brjod par bya grang na /
translated: does it arise from one of those conditions?

original: sngar skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bstan pa'i tshul gyis de dag rnam pa thams cad las kyang de skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bstan pa'i tshul gyis de dag rnam pa thams cad las kyang de skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: But in no way does it arise, as was previously explained in the chapter on nonarising.

original: don dam par rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ba bstan dka'o //
analyzed: don dam par rkyen gyi stobs kyis skye ba bstan dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to teach that it arises by the power of conditions ultimately.

original: ji ste sgyu ma la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhin du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i skye ba spyir brjod na ni tha snyad kyi bden pa bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: ji ste sgyu ma la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhin du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i skye ba spyir brjod na ni tha snyad kyi bden pa bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: If you say that arising is like the arising of an illusion, etc., and is not to be described in general, then you are establishing conventional truth.

original: ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / gnyi ga dang yod pa dang med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs pa'i skye ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / gnyi ga dang yod pa dang med pa dang /
translated: If the Yogacaras say that the other-dependent nature arises like an illusion, etc., on the conventional level, and that its reality, otherness, both, existence, nonexistence,

original: yod med du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i skye ba dbu ma pa la sogs pa dang / spyir mthun par brjod na ni tha snyad kyi bden pa bsgrub pa yin pas /
analyzed: yod med du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i skye ba dbu ma pa la sogs pa dang / spyir mthun par brjod na ni tha snyad kyi bden pa bsgrub pa yin pas /
translated: and inexpressibility in terms of existence and nonexistence are in general the same as those of the Madhyamikas, etc., then they are establishing conventional truth.

original: don dam par gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yod de zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don dam par gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yod de zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that ultimately the other-dependent nature arises and that it is realitylessness because of being realityless.

original: de lta na kun rdzob tu /
analyzed: de lta na kun rdzob tu /
translated: In that case, conventionally,

original: rkyen gyi stobs kyis skyes pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid la skye ba med par ston pas /
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs kyis skyes pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid la skye ba med par ston pas /
translated: Since it teaches that there is no essential arising, arising by the power of conditions is like a magicianâ€™s illusion, and so on.

original: dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i rjes su smra bas kyang yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i rjes su smra bas kyang yin te /
translated: It is also a follower of the Madhyamaka becauseğŸ”½the method of the Madhyamaka treatises

original: dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos kyi tshul ni /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos kyi tshul ni /
translated: is as follows:

original: rten cing 'brel bar gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises dependently

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: is explained to be emptiness.ğŸ”½Since it teaches that things do not arise from themselves,

original: ces bya bas dngos po rnams rang las skye ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni de ltar kun rdzob tu rkyen gyi stobs kyis skyes pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par ston na ni /
analyzed: ces bya bas dngos po rnams rang las skye ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni de ltar kun rdzob tu rkyen gyi stobs kyis skyes pa sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par ston na ni /

translated: Since external objects do not exist, the dependent nature is not apprehended as a reason, and therefore it is not seen correctly.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

analyzed: de ni lan ma yin te /

translated: Because the words of the sutra are explained in another way.ğŸ”½The sutra of the ten levels of bodhisattvas says, â€œO child of the conquerors, it is like this. This three realm world is mind only.â€

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa ni sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po dang zab po med par dgag pa'i phyir sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /

analyzed: khyed kyis mdo sde'i tshig gzhan du log par bshad pa'i phyir de ni lan ma yin no //
translated: Since you explain the words of the sutra in another way, that is not a response.

original: gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don mngon sum ma yin pa de ni lung dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni khyed kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don phyi rol gyi yul dang dbang po ni med la nang gi sems 'ba'ğŸ”½zhig yod pa mngon sum gyi spyod yul ma yin pa de ni lung dang rjes su dpag pa dag yod na de dag gis 'grub pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don mngon sum ma yin pa de ni lung dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni khyed kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don phyi rol gyi yul dang dbang po ni med la nang gi sems 'ba' zhig yod pa mngon sum gyi spyod yul ma yin pa de ni lung dang rjes su dpag pa dag yod na de dag gis 'grub pa yin na /
translated: This means that the object of affirmation, which is the external object and sense faculty, does not exist, and the internal mind alone, which is not the domain of direct perception, is established by means of scripture and inference if they exist.

original: khyed la phyi rol gyi don bsal zhing nang gi sems tsam yod pa nyid du ston pa'i lung yang med la de bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang med pas kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi yul dang dbang po rnams yul ma yin pa nyid du bya ba
analyzed: khyed la phyi rol gyi don bsal zhing nang gi sems tsam yod pa nyid du ston pa'i lung yang med la de bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang med pas kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi yul dang dbang po rnams yul ma yin pa nyid du bya ba
translated: However, you do not have scripture that eliminates external objects and reveals the existence of mere internal mind, nor do you have an inference that establishes that. Therefore, it is not reasonable to eliminate the existence of external objects and sense faculties as objects in the conventional sense,

original: byed nus par sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don du yod pa sel bar byed pa yang mi rigs la /

translated: and to establish that they are able to perform functions like illusions and so on as objects that exist within the domain of direct perception.

analyzed: don @288b dam par gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par ston pa yang mi rigs pas de ni lan ma yin no //
translated: Since it is illogical to teach that the dependent nature exists ultimately, this is not a response.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag kun rdzob tu yang phyi rol gyi yul dang dbang po ni mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag kun rdzob tu yang phyi rol gyi yul dang dbang po ni mi 'dod la /

translated: Here, it is shown that the YogÄcÄra have inferences and scriptures that prove the nonexistence of external objects.

analyzed: de la re zhig rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, to demonstrate their inferences,

analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa ni tsee tra la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: the text says: If consciousness is empty of objects such as form,

original: 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang ; 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / dus su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na rang gi bag chags thob pas 'jug pa'i rmi lam gyis sems bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: Because they engage, because they are results, because they are impermanent, because they are not moving, and because they engage in a timely way, they are like the mind in a dream that engages through obtaining its own habitual tendencies.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

translated: For example, the mind in a dream that engages through obtaining its own habitual tendencies is empty of the meaning of Caitra because it engages, because it is a result, because it is impermanent, because it is not moving, and because it engages in a timely way.

translated: Although external objects do not exist, due to the power of engaging in oneâ€™s own latent propensities, objects such as Caitra, Maitra, Devadatta, and YajÃ±adatta appear in oneâ€™s own mindstream, even though they do not exist externally.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / dus su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir tsee tra la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / dus su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir tsee tra la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa yin te /

translated: Although external objects do not exist due to the power of engaging in oneâ€™s own latent propensities, objects such as Caitra, Maitra, Devadatta, and YajÃ±adatta appear in oneâ€™s own mindstream, even though they do not exist externally. Therefore it is inferred that external objects do not exist.

original: da ni lung yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lung yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that there are also scriptures,ğŸ”½the treatise states:

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas 'dra bar //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas 'dra bar //
translated: The mind appears as bodies, enjoyments, and abodes.

original: sems ni sna tshogs snang bas na //

translated: Since the mind appears as various things,

analyzed: @289a * // sems tsam du ni nga smra'o //
translated: I declare that there is mind only.â€

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: Thus, there is no error.

translated: Since the noble Descent into Laá¹…kÄ SÅ«tra teaches this, mind only is established by scripture and inference.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi rjes su dpag pa'i don kyang mi 'grub la /
translated: In response to this statement, the author of the commentary explains that the meaning of the YogÄcÄra inference is not established.

analyzed: de dag gi lung yang log par bshad pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don med pa'i sems tsam du mi 'grub kyi /
translated: And since their scripture is explained incorrectly, mind only without external objects is not established.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi don yod pas rnam par shes pa tsee tra la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa ma yin la /

translated: The scriptures that teach â€œmind onlyâ€ are intended to refute an agent and experiencer that is different from the mind, but they are not intended to refute external objects.ğŸ”½In order to demonstrate that this is established by other scriptures and reasonings, he says, â€œThe meaning of the statement â€˜consciousness is empty of objectsâ€™ isâ€¦â€

original: 'dis ni re zhig rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis rnam par shes pa ni tsee tra la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to //

translated: This shows that the YogÄcÄras first make the claim â€œconsciousness is empty of objects,â€ and then they analyze the meaning of that claim.

original: gal te de'i don phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par bag chags kyi sa bon gyi rgyu las rnam par shes pa skye ba yin na ni zhes bya bas ni gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis rnam par shes pa ni tsee tra la sogs
analyzed: gal te de'i don phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par bag chags kyi sa bon gyi rgyu las rnam par shes pa skye ba yin na ni zhes bya bas ni gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis rnam par shes pa ni tsee tra la sogs
translated: If the meaning of that were that consciousness arises from the cause of the seed of latent propensities without depending on external conditions, then the YogÄcÄra would be correct in their assertion that consciousness is empty of the object of the eye faculty and so on.

analyzed: pa'i don gyis stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag nyid 'dod pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul gyi rkyen la mi ltos par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi bag chags thob pas 'jug pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu
translated: The meaning of that assertion is that the YogÄcÄra themselves assert that consciousness does not depend on external objects as conditions but arises from the cause of the seed of the foundation consciousness that is obtained through its own latent propensities.

original: la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid don dang / sems can dang / bdag dang / rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba yul dang / dbang po dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi rnam par skye ba yin nam zhes pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid don dang / sems can dang / bdag dang / rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba yul dang / dbang po dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gi rnam par skye ba yin nam zhes pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
translated: The root text presents the opponentâ€™s position: â€œThe foundation consciousness itself is the object, and the consciousnesses such as the sentient being, the self, the afflicted mind, and the operative consciousnesses arise in the aspect of the object, the sense faculty, the afflicted mind, and the operative consciousnesses.â€

original: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de la gal te don dam par phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa skye ba ston na dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de la gal te don dam par phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa skye ba ston na dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Now, to demonstrate that this position is untenable, the root text states, â€œIf you are demonstrating that consciousness arises without depending on external conditions, then there is no example.â€

original: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gi dper rang gi bag chags thob pas 'jug pas @289b rmi lam gyi sems bzhin no zhes bya ba don dam par mi 'grub par ston te /
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gi dper rang gi bag chags thob pas 'jug pas @289b rmi lam gyi sems bzhin no zhes bya ba don dam par mi 'grub par ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the YogÄcÄra example, â€œLike the mind in a dream,â€ is not established ultimately.

original: 'di ltar don dam par rang gi bag chags thob par 'jug pa'i rmi lam gyi sems nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pas pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par rang gi bag chags thob par 'jug pa'i rmi lam gyi sems nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pas pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, because the mind itself in a dream, which engages in the attainment of its own habitual tendencies ultimately does not arise, the example subject is not established. Therefore, the meaning of the opponentâ€™s thesis is not established.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid las dpe ni gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis bstan par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid las dpe ni gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis bstan par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, â€œThe example is taught by the power of the subject that is renowned to both parties and the property of the probandum and the property of the proof.â€

original: re zhig des ni don dam par phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa skye bar ston na /
analyzed: re zhig des ni don dam par phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa skye bar ston na /
translated: If you teach that consciousness arises without depending on external conditions ultimately,

analyzed: dpe med pas ma grub pa bstan to //
translated: then you have taught that it is not established because it has no example.

original: da ni kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa skye bar ston na grags pas gnod par 'gyur bas mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rnam par shes pa skye bar ston na grags pas gnod par 'gyur bas mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, if you teach that consciousness arises without depending on external conditions conventionally, then you have taught that it is not established because it is undermined by what is renowned.

original: ji ste tha snyad du na ni grags pas gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ste tha snyad du na ni grags pas gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it was said, â€œIf it is conventionally, then it is undermined by what is renowned.â€

original: tha snyad du rnam par shes pa yul dang dbang po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rkyen rnams la ltos te skye bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du rnam par shes pa yul dang dbang po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rkyen rnams la ltos te skye bar grags pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Thus here the mind alone is known to be the creator, but the person, causes, aggregates, conditions, atoms, primal matter, ÄªÅ›vara, and so on are not creators.

translated: This is a statement by YogÄcÄras that proves that things that have form are the essence of mind.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

original: dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gzugs can rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas phyi rol gyi yul
analyzed: dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gzugs can rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas phyi rol gyi yul
translated: In the same way, because physical things are the objects of consciousness, they are the nature of mind.

original: med par grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: med par grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore external objects do not exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i len du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

translated: In response to that statement, the author of this commentary says:

analyzed: sems las byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is not definite because of mental factors.

original: de dag ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du ston te /

translated: This shows that the reason stated by YogÄcÄras, because it is the object of consciousness, is not definite.

original: 'di na sems las byung ba'i chos rnams rnam par shes pa'i yul yin yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du dngos po gzugs canğŸ”½rnams sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di na sems las byung ba'i chos rnams rnam par shes pa'i yul yin yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du dngos po gzugs can rnams sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Here, mental factors are objects of consciousness but are not seen as the essence of mind. Therefore, are things that are objects of consciousness, like the immediately preceding condition, the essence of mind, or are things that are objects of consciousness, like mental factors, not the essence of mind?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na sems las byung ba dag bzhin du dngos po gzugs can rnams sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na sems las byung ba dag bzhin du dngos po gzugs can rnams sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa /
translated: Since it is not definite, the meaning of the opponentâ€™s reason is not established.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par ston na yang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag 'di skad ces gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dag ni sems dang sems las @292b byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par ston na yang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag 'di skad ces gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dag ni sems dang sems las @292b byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: the Yogacarins say this: Form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility are the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin pas /
translated: Because they are objects of consciousness, like the immediately preceding condition,

original: dngos po gzugs can rnams sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po gzugs can rnams sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: material things are the nature of mind.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis so sor ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis so sor ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: we say that mind and mental factors are not ascertained individually.

original: de lta na yang pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na yang pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: Even so, the opponentâ€™s reason, â€œbecause they are objects of consciousness,â€ is not ascertained.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i su la yin yang sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid tha dad par mthong bas /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i su la yin yang sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid tha dad par mthong bas /
translated: This is because those who possess consciousness see that minds and mental factors have different natures.

original: des na ji re zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des na ji re zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, do form and so on have the nature of mind because they are objects of consciousness, like the immediately preceding condition?
