analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dag gcig gi ngo bo nyid gcig ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa de dag kyang sems
translated: Or do form and so on not have the nature of mind and mental factors because they are objects of consciousness, like minds and mental factors do not have the same nature?

original: kyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: kyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: Form and so on that have the nature of mind are not the nature of mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dag gis so sor ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis sems kyi ngo bo nyidğŸ”½yin par ma grub bo //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dag gis so sor ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the reason that form and so on are objects of consciousness does not establish that they are the nature of mind.

original: ji ste 'di skad ces sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis so sor ma nges pa nyid ma
analyzed: ji ste 'di skad ces sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis so sor ma nges pa nyid ma
translated: If you say, â€œMental factors are a specific state of mind, and because mind and mental factors are not different in nature, they are not ascertained as being different,â€

original: yin no zhes zer na de'i lan du gal te don dam par sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig par brjod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: yin no zhes zer na de'i lan du gal te don dam par sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig par brjod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: then in response to that, if you say that ultimately mind and mental factors are one nature, that is proving what is already established.

original: 'di ltar don dam par chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately all phenomena are nondual.

original: 'on te tha snyad du sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig par brjod na ni khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yang yin te zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad du sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig par brjod na ni khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yang yin te zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But if you say that mind and mental factors are essentially the same conventionally, then we would say that contradicts your tenets.

original: khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of your tenets?ğŸ”½The mode is stated in the line:

original: tshul ni / de la don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: tshul ni / de la don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness sees the object,

original: de yi bye brag sems las byung //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½yul de la don gyi ngo bo nyid tsam mthong ba ni rnam @293a * //
analyzed: de yi bye brag sems las byung // zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / yul de la don gyi ngo bo nyid tsam mthong ba ni rnam @293a * //
translated: mental factors cognize its attributes.

original: par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: par shes pa yin la /
translated: Thus, seeing the mere nature of the object is consciousness.ğŸ”½Cognizing the attributes of that object is mental factors.

original: don de'i bye brag rig pa ni sems pas byung ba dag yin no zhes khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' las byung ba dang 'gal bas tha snyad du sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig go zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don de'i bye brag rig pa ni sems pas byung ba dag yin no zhes khyed kyi grub pa'i mtha' las byung ba dang 'gal bas tha snyad du sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig go zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since this contradicts your tenets, it is not tenable to say that mind and mental factors are essentially the same conventionally.

original: snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa'i skyon yang yod do zhes bya bas ni tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin zhing sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang ngo bo nyid gcig go zhes dam bca'
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa'i skyon yang yod do zhes bya bas ni tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin zhing sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang ngo bo nyid gcig go zhes dam bca'
translated: If one asserts that conventionally forms and so on are objects that are the nature of mind and mental factors, and that mind and mental factors are the same nature,

original: na / sngar dpe med pa dang / grags pas gnod pa dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba don med pa nyid dang / tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i don snang ba med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i skyon dag kyang yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: na / sngar dpe med pa dang / grags pas gnod pa dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba don med pa nyid dang / tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i don snang ba med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i skyon dag kyang yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: then the errors previously explained would also occur: it would be unprecedented, it would be undermined by what is renowned, it would be uncertain, the occurrence of buddhas would be pointless, and objects belonging to conventional truth would not appear.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la gzugs kyi blo 'di'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam 'dus pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag la sogs pa gang dag phyi rol gyi yul med par 'dod pa dag na
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la gzugs kyi blo 'di'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam 'dus pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag la sogs pa gang dag phyi rol gyi yul med par 'dod pa dag na
translated: Those who say that the object of the cognition of form is either a single subtle particle of form or an aggregation of particles and so on are YogÄcÄras and so forth who assert that external objects do not exist.

original: re dbu ma pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi yul yod par 'dod pa dag gang gi gzhung las gzugs kyi blo'i yul phyi rol gyi gzugs yin par 'dod pa de /
analyzed: re dbu ma pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi yul yod par 'dod pa dag gang gi gzhung las gzugs kyi blo'i yul phyi rol gyi gzugs yin par 'dod pa de /
translated: The opponentâ€™s position is that the mind of form is the object of the mind of form.

original: ji gzugs kyi blo mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam /
analyzed: ji gzugs kyi blo mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam /
translated: Is the object of the mind of form a single particle of form, an external object?

original: 'on te 'dus pa yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dus pa yin grang na /
translated: Or is it a composite?

original: de gnyis ka yang gzugs kyi blo yul du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang gzugs kyi blo yul du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir /
translated: Neither of these two is tenable as the object of the mind of form.

original: phyi rol gyi yul yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i gzhung ston to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i gzhung ston to //
translated: Therefore, external objects do not exist.

original: de la re zhig rdul phra rab phyi gzugs gcig gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin par sgrub pa'i gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½de la rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rdul phra rab phyi gzugs gcig gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin par sgrub pa'i gzhung bstan pa'i phyir / de la rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: To explain the treatise that proves this, first the treatise that proves that a single particle of form is not the object of the mind of form is presented.

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: A single particle of form is not the object of the mind of form because it does not appear.

original: dper na mig bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mig bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the eye.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po ni mi snang ba'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig kyang mi snang ba'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po ni mi snang ba'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig kyang mi snang ba'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no //
translated: For example, the eye faculty is not an object of the cognition of form because it is not visible. In the same way, a single subtle particle of form is not an object of the cognition of form because it is not visible.

original: da ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin par sgrub pa'i @293b gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin par sgrub pa'i @293b gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the treatise that proves that the aggregation of subtle particles is not an object of the cognition of form, it is said:

original: ci ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
translated: But if it is an aggregation, it is not an object of the cognition of form.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it does not substantially exist, like the appearance of two moons.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa yang dmag dang nags tshal dang shing rta la sogs pa bzhin du 'dus pa spyi la
analyzed: dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa yang dmag dang nags tshal dang shing rta la sogs pa bzhin du 'dus pa spyi la
translated: For example, the appearance of two moons is not the object of a cognition of form because it does not substantially exist.

original: gdags pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gdags pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Likewise, the form of subtle particles in aggregation is not the object of a cognition of form because it does not substantially exist, like an army, a forest, a chariot, and so on, which are imputed to be a generality of an aggregation.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la gal te don dam par mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa nyid dang / gzugs kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gog par byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te don dam par mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa nyid dang / gzugs kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gog par byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you refute the ultimate eye consciousness observing form and form being the object of observation of the eye consciousness, then you are proving what is already established.

original: ci ste tha snyad du ni grags pas gnod do zhes smras te /
analyzed: ci ste tha snyad du ni grags pas gnod do zhes smras te /
translated: If you say that it is undermined by what is renowned conventionally,

original: don dam par ni yul dang rnam par shes pa skye ba med par dbu ma pa'i phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir dang tha snyad du ni yul dang rnam par shes pa yod par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni yul dang rnam par shes pa skye ba med par dbu ma pa'i phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir dang tha snyad du ni yul dang rnam par shes pa yod par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately, the nonarising of objects and consciousness is established even in the Madhyamaka position, and conventionally, objects and consciousness exist, as is known in the world.ğŸ”½The meaning of the statement â€œThe subtle particles are not objects of the sensory consciousnessesâ€ is this:

original: rdul phra rab dag dbang po'i rnam par rig pa dag gi yul ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa de'i don kyang gang yin zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la gzugs kyi blo 'di'i yul rdul
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag dbang po'i rnam par rig pa dag gi yul ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa de'i don kyang gang yin zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la gzugs kyi blo 'di'i yul rdul
translated: The Madhyamaka previously said to the YogÄcÄra, â€œIn this regard, is the object of this cognition of form a single subtle particle of form?

original: phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam /ğŸ”½'dus pa yin zhes zer bas rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig gam /
analyzed: phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam / 'dus pa yin zhes zer bas rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig gam /
translated: Or is it a collection?â€ğŸ”½The YogÄcÄra replied, â€œA single subtle particle of form or a collection of subtle particles is not the object of the cognition of form.â€

original: 'dus pa dag gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin par dam bca' ba de'i don kyang ci gzugs kyi blo'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs dag ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dus pa dag gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin par dam bca' ba de'i don kyang ci gzugs kyi blo'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs dag ma yin na /
translated: The meaning of that statement is this: â€œIf the subtle particles of form are not the object of the cognition of form,

original: de las gzhan zhig yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: de las gzhan zhig yod pa yin nam /
translated: is there something that is other than that which is the object of the cognition of form?â€

original: 'on te rdul phra rab kyi gzugs dag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab kyi gzugs dag kyang ma yin la /
translated: But if it is neither the form of subtle particles nor other than that,ğŸ”½then it is a non-existent object.

original: gzhan yang med pas yul ji yang med pa yin no zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang med pas yul ji yang med pa yin no zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Thus two possibilities are presented.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, to demonstrate that the first possibility is untenable,

original: gal te yul gzhan yod pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan yod pa yin na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, â€œIf the object exists, the former position is undermined.â€

original: khyed kyis sngar ni gzugs kyi blo'i yul med par dam bca' la /ğŸ”½da ni de'i yul @294a * //
analyzed: khyed kyis sngar ni gzugs kyi blo'i yul med par dam bca' la / da ni de'i yul @294a * //
translated: Previously you asserted that the object of the cognition of form does not exist,ğŸ”½but now you accept that it exists as something other than the form of subtle particles.

original: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs dag ma yin pa de las gzhan zhig yod par khas blangs pas rang gi phyogs snga ma la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs dag ma yin pa de las gzhan zhig yod par khas blangs pas rang gi phyogs snga ma la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus your former position is undermined.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the second possibility is untenable,

original: gal te de la yul med na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te de la yul med na ni dpe med de /
translated: it is said, â€œIf it has no object, there is no example.â€

original: gzugs kyi blo phyogs su byas pa yul med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo phyogs su byas pa yul med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the cognition of form is not established as having no object, it is not an example.

original: gang gi phyir khyed kyis gzugs kyi blo la yul med do zhes phyogs su byas pa de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo yul med par ma grub pas des na khyed kyi sgrub pa gzugs kyi blo la yul med de zhes dam bcas pa de'i dpe yang gzugs kyi blo
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed kyis gzugs kyi blo la yul med do zhes phyogs su byas pa de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo yul med par ma grub pas des na khyed kyi sgrub pa gzugs kyi blo la yul med de zhes dam bcas pa de'i dpe yang gzugs kyi blo
translated: Because you have taken the position that the mind of form has no object, therefore, since the mind of form is not established as having no object, your proof, â€œThe mind of form has no object,â€ is not established.ğŸ”½

original: yul med pa gzhan 'ga' zhig las blang dgos na dper bya ba'i gzugs kyi blo gzhan de yang gzugs kyi blo yin pa'i phyir yul med par ma grub pa'i phyir te gzugs kyi blo yul med par bsgrub pa phyogs su byas pa 'di'i dper mi rung ba'i phyir
analyzed: yul med pa gzhan 'ga' zhig las blang dgos na dper bya ba'i gzugs kyi blo gzhan de yang gzugs kyi blo yin pa'i phyir yul med par ma grub pa'i phyir te gzugs kyi blo yul med par bsgrub pa phyogs su byas pa 'di'i dper mi rung ba'i phyir
translated: Because you have taken the position that the mind of form has no object, you have not established that the mind of form is without an object. Therefore, you must take an example of your thesis, â€œThe mind of form has no object,â€ from somewhere else. But that other mind of form that you take as your example is also a mind of form, and therefore it is not established to be without an object. It is not suitable to be an example of the position that the mind of form is without an object.

original: ro // gzhan yang blo rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa dang ; bstsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu la dmigs pa dag phyogs su byas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis 'di la gzugs kyi blo 'di'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam /ğŸ”½'dus pa yin zhes smras pas /
analyzed: ro // gzhan yang blo rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa dang ; bstsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu la dmigs pa dag phyogs su byas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis 'di la gzugs kyi blo 'di'i yul rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig yin nam / 'dus pa yin zhes smras pas /
translated: The logicians say, â€œIs the object of this cognition of form a single particle or an aggregation of particles?â€

original: gzugs kyi blo rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa dang bsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu la dmigs pa dag phyogs su byas nas de gnyi ga mi 'grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs de gnyis ka la yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang grub
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa dang bsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu la dmigs pa dag phyogs su byas nas de gnyi ga mi 'grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs de gnyis ka la yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang grub
translated: The logicians say, â€œThe cognition of form focuses on a single particle or an aggregation of particles, and so on. Both of these positions are untenable.â€

original: pa nyid dang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yod par ston to //
analyzed: pa nyid dang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yod par ston to //
translated: The logicians say, â€œThe reason is not established, it is established, it is established, and the basis is not established.â€

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the fault that the reason is not established, the root text says:

original: gcig gi dus la ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gcig gi dus la ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: At the time of one, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: bstsags pa'i gzugs rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gzhan gyis phan btags pa gcig pu yang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir de'i blo yod pas de mi snang ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bstsags pa'i gzugs rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gzhan gyis phan btags pa gcig pu yang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir de'i blo yod pas de mi snang ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the form of an accumulation of subtle particles, which is a form that is helped by another, is a single entity that generates a cognition that perceives itself, it is not established that cognition of it does not perceive it.

original: des ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re de la rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re de la rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: This is because the YogÄcÄra say that the form of a single subtle particle is not an object of the cognition of form because it does not appear, like the eye sense faculty.

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir dper na mig bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir dper na mig bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the meaning of the reason, because it does not appear, is not established.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra @294b rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu yang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra @294b rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu yang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo skyed par byed de /
translated: In this way, the form of a single subtle particle that is not an accumulation generates a cognition that perceives itself.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na mi mang po'i lag rus kyis sdong po chen po bshal ba'i dus na mi mang po de dag gcig gi mthus gcig pa phan btags pa spyi'i mthus sdong bu de bshal nus par gyur pa na mi mang po de dag las mi gcig bu'i mthu re
analyzed: dper na mi mang po'i lag rus kyis sdong po chen po bshal ba'i dus na mi mang po de dag gcig gi mthus gcig pa phan btags pa spyi'i mthus sdong bu de bshal nus par gyur pa na mi mang po de dag las mi gcig bu'i mthu re
translated: For example, when many people are sawing a large log, the log is sawn by the power of the general collection of the people, not by the power of one person alone.

original: re nas mi snang yang spyir snang ba'i tshe na mi gcig pu de'i mthu yang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo skyed pa yin pa'i phyir de'i mthu mi snang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa mang po 'dus pa la
analyzed: re nas mi snang yang spyir snang ba'i tshe na mi gcig pu de'i mthu yang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo skyed pa yin pa'i phyir de'i mthu mi snang ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa mang po 'dus pa la
translated: When the log is sawn, the power of each person is not apparent, but when the power of the general collection is apparent, the power of each person is also apparent.ğŸ”½In the same way, when the mind observing form observes the accumulation of many subtle particles, the form of the many subtle particles is connected and supported by the form of one particle.

original: gzugs kyi blos dmigs pa'i dus na rdul phra rab kyi gzugs mang po de dag gcig gi gzugs kyis gcig la sbyar cing phan btags pa na spyi 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo de'i yul du gyur pa na rdul phra rab kyi gzugs mang po de dag las gcig
analyzed: gzugs kyi blos dmigs pa'i dus na rdul phra rab kyi gzugs mang po de dag gcig gi gzugs kyis gcig la sbyar cing phan btags pa na spyi 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo de'i yul du gyur pa na rdul phra rab kyi gzugs mang po de dag las gcig
translated: When the general collection becomes the object of the mind observing form, the form of the many subtle particles is not apparent, but the form of the general collection is apparent.

original: pu'i gzugs re re nas mi snang yang spyir snang ba'i tshe na rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig pu de'i gzugs kyang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo skyed pa yin pa'i phyir de'i gzugs mi snang ba ma yin pas mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan
analyzed: pu'i gzugs re re nas mi snang yang spyir snang ba'i tshe na rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig pu de'i gzugs kyang rang gi bdag nyid snang ba'i blo skyed pa yin pa'i phyir de'i gzugs mi snang ba ma yin pas mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan
translated: Although the form of each atom does not appear, when the form of the collection appears, the form of that single atom also generates the cognition that perceives itself. Therefore its form is not unobservable.ğŸ”½

original: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Although the form of each atom is not visible, when they are generally visible, the form of that single subtle particle is also the cause of the mind that perceives its own nature. Therefore, since its form is not invisible, the meaning of the reason â€œbecause it is invisibleâ€ is not established.

original: phyogs dang po'i gtan tshigs grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs dang po'i gtan tshigs grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the error of proving what has already been established in the first case, he says:

original: gzhan gyi dus la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: It is the proof of what has already been established in the case of the other.

original: bstsags pa ma yin pa'i gzugs mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bstsags pa ma yin pa'i gzugs mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not accepted that nonaccumulated form is the object of eye consciousness.

original: des ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re de la /
analyzed: des ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re de la /
translated: In this regard, the YogÄcÄras previously said:

original: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni /
translated: One subtle particle of form

original: gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: is not the object of the consciousness of form.

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir dper na mig bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa la sgrub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir dper na mig bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa la sgrub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: Because it does not appear, it is like the eye.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pas kyang rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pas kyang rdul phra rab kyi gzugs bstsags pa ma yin pa gcig pu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because we Madhyamikas also do not accept that a single, uncompounded subtle particle is the object of eye consciousness.

original: sde pa gzhan dag la yang de grub pa la sgrub pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag la yang de grub pa la sgrub pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that this is also a proof that is established for the opponent, he says:

original: chos mngon pa las kyang gzugs can bcu ni bstsags pa'o zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang gzugs can bcu ni bstsags pa'o zhes 'byung bas /
translated: In the Abhidharma it says, â€œThe ten physical constituents are compounded.â€

original: de'i phyir bstsags pa ma yin pa ni yul gyi dngos por mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstsags pa ma yin pa ni yul gyi dngos por mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that that which is not compounded is not established as an object.

original: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de sde pa gzhan dag gi phyogs @295a * //
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de sde pa gzhan dag gi phyogs @295a * //
translated: This shows that the Yogacarasâ€™ reason, â€œbecause it does not appear,â€ is a proof that is established for the opponent.

original: la yang grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: la yang grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Also, it is taught that if one asserts that the object of observation of a consciousness is a non-existent, the fault of establishing what is already established accrues.

original: phyogs dang po'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs dang po'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the fault that the basis of the reason of the first position is not established,ğŸ”½it is said, â€œThe assertion that the consciousness of form arises without observing form is not established as the consciousness that does not observe form is the consciousness of the eye sense faculty itself, because it does not appear.â€

original: gzugs la dmigs pa med par gzugs kyi blo skye bar dam 'cha' ba ni gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pa'i blo ni mig gi dbang po'i blo nyid yin par mi 'grub pas de mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyidğŸ”½do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa med par gzugs kyi blo skye bar dam 'cha' ba ni gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pa'i blo ni mig gi dbang po'i blo nyid yin par mi 'grub pas de mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The basis of the reason â€œbecause it does not appearâ€ is not established.

original: des ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re de la rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re de la rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: This demonstrates that the reason â€œbecause it does not appearâ€ stated by the YogÄcÄras earlier, â€œIn that regard, the form of a single subtle particle is not the object field of the consciousness of form,

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir dper na mig bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i gzhi ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir dper na mig bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i gzhi ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: because it does not appear, like the eye,â€ has a basis that is not established.

original: sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te zhes smras pa de nyid kyis gzugs la dmigs pa med par yang gzugs kyi blo skye bar dam bcas pa yin pas /ğŸ”½des na gzugs la dmigs pa med pa'i blo ni mig gi dbang po'i blo nyid yin par mi 'grub pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo nyid med pas /
analyzed: sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis rdul phra rab kyi gzugs gcig ni gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te zhes smras pa de nyid kyis gzugs la dmigs pa med par yang gzugs kyi blo skye bar dam bcas pa yin pas / des na gzugs la dmigs pa med pa'i blo ni mig gi dbang po'i blo nyid yin par mi 'grub pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo nyid med pas /
translated: Previously, the Yogacaras said that a single subtle particle of form is not the object of the cognition of form. By that very statement, they have also committed themselves to the fact that the cognition of form arises without the object of form.ğŸ”½Therefore, since the cognition that does not observe form is not established as the cognition of the eye faculty, the cognition of form itself does not exist.

original: des na pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gzhi ma grub pa nyid de gzugs kyi blo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des na pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de mi snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gzhi ma grub pa nyid de gzugs kyi blo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is shown that the reason of the opponent, â€œbecause it does not appear,â€ is not established, because the cognition of form itself is not established.

original: gzugs la blo'i yul 'dus pa nyid la yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de la snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi spyi ste 'dus pa yin nağŸ”½ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la blo'i yul 'dus pa nyid la yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de la snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi spyi ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The error of the thesis is the same as before.ğŸ”½The second position is that the universal is not the object of the cognition of form because it does not substantially exist, like the appearance of two moons.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes smras pa'i phyogs gnyis pa de la yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon snga ma bzhin du sbyar bston te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes smras pa'i phyogs gnyis pa de la yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon snga ma bzhin du sbyar bston te /
translated: This is also shown to have the same errors as before: the meaning of the reason is not established and the reason is not established and the basis of the reason is not established.

original: sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin par dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de mi 'grub ste /ğŸ”½rdzas su yod pa ma yin yang dmag dang nags tshal dang / shing rta la sogs pa gzugs kyi blos skyed pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir @295b dang ; rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin par dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de mi 'grub ste / rdzas su yod pa ma yin yang dmag dang nags tshal dang / shing rta la sogs pa gzugs kyi blos skyed pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir @295b dang ; rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The reason previously stated by YogÄcÄras, â€œbecause it does not substantially exist,â€ is not established.ğŸ”½Though it does not substantially exist, it is an object that generates the cognition of form, like an army, a forest, a bush, a chariot, and so on.

original: dbu ma pa dang / sde pa gzhan dag gis kyang 'dus pa rdzas su yod pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / de'i gzhi ma grub pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa dang / sde pa gzhan dag gis kyang 'dus pa rdzas su yod pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / de'i gzhi ma grub pa yang yin te /
translated: The reason â€œbecause it does not substantially existâ€ is also established as a proof, because neither the MÄdhyamika nor other schools accept that an aggregation substantially exists, and it is also not established as a basis.

original: 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te zhes smras pa de nyid kyis gzugs la dmigs pa med par gzugs kyi blo skye bar dam bcas pas gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pa'i blo ni mig gi dbang po'i blo nyid yin par mi 'grub pas rdzas su
analyzed: 'dus pa gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te zhes smras pa de nyid kyis gzugs la dmigs pa med par gzugs kyi blo skye bar dam bcas pas gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pa'i blo ni mig gi dbang po'i blo nyid yin par mi 'grub pas rdzas su
translated: The statement â€œThe composite is not an object of the mind that perceives formâ€ itself commits you to the assertion that a mind perceiving form arises without observing form.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /ğŸ”½// / bam po bdun cu brgyad pa ;
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po bdun cu brgyad pa ;
translated: Therefore, since it is not established that the mind that does not observe form is the mind of the eye faculty, the reason â€œbecause it does not exist substantiallyâ€ is not established.

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba yang gal te don yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba yang gal te don yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that the appearance of two moons is an object,

original: de rang dang gzhan la mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de rang dang gzhan la mi 'grub ste /
translated: then it is not established for you or for others,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis ci ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis ci ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
translated: because such an object is impossible.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de mi 'grub par ston te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de mi 'grub par ston te /
translated: The example you cite is not established.ğŸ”½If the example you cite, â€œlike the appearance of two moons,â€ is an external object, then it is not a substantially existent object of a cognition of form because it is not substantially existent.

original: khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang gal te phyi rol gyi don yin pa de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa yangğŸ”½phyi rol gyi don yin la /
analyzed: khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang gal te phyi rol gyi don yin pa de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa yang phyi rol gyi don yin la /
translated: In the same way, the form of an aggregation of subtle particles is an external object.ğŸ”½But it is not a substantially existent object of a cognition of form because it is not substantially existent.

original: de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no zhes bya bar sgrub na ni khyed kyi dpe de rang dang gzhan la mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no zhes bya bar sgrub na ni khyed kyi dpe de rang dang gzhan la mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you prove this, then your example is not established for you or for others.

original: ji ltar na zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i phyi rol gyi don yin no zhes bya ba de khyed cag gi phyi rol gyi don med par smra ba rang gi phyogs la yang zla ba gnyis su snang ba de lta bu'i don mi srid pa'i phyir dang ;ğŸ”½kho bo cag phyi rol don yod par smra ba gzhan gyi phyogs la yang zla ba gnyis pa snang ba de lta bu'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i phyi rol gyi don yin no zhes bya ba de khyed cag gi phyi rol gyi don med par smra ba rang gi phyogs la yang zla ba gnyis su snang ba de lta bu'i don mi srid pa'i phyir dang ; kho bo cag phyi rol don yod par smra ba gzhan gyi phyogs la yang zla ba gnyis pa snang ba de lta bu'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: you say that the appearance of two moons is an external object, but in your own system, which advocates that external objects do not exist, such an object is impossible.ğŸ”½And in the system of others, who advocate that external objects exist, such an object is also impossible.ğŸ”½But if you say that the appearance of two moons is the mind, then the example is flawed because the property of the subject is not established, since it is not established that it is not a substantial existent.

original: 'on te zla ba gnyis su snang ba blo yin no zhe na ni de rdzas su yod pa ma yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dpe la sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni 'on te khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis
analyzed: 'on te zla ba gnyis su snang ba blo yin no zhe na ni de rdzas su yod pa ma yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dpe la sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni 'on te khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis
translated: The phrase â€œBut if you say that the appearance of two moons is the mindâ€ is a response to the following argument of the opponent.ğŸ”½The opponent says, â€œThe example is not flawed because the property of the subject is not established.

original: su snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i phyi rol gyi don ma yin gyi /
analyzed: su snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i phyi rol gyi don ma yin gyi /
translated: The appearance of two moons is not an external object.

original: nang gi sems yin la /
analyzed: nang gi sems yin la /
translated: It is an internal mind.

original: de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa yang phyi rol gyi don ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'dus pa yang phyi rol gyi don ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as the object of the cognition of form is not a form that exists substantially, so too the form of an aggregation of subtle particles is not an external object.

original: nang gi sems yin la de rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i @296a * //ğŸ”½zla ba gnyis /
analyzed: nang gi sems yin la de rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i @296a * // zla ba gnyis /
translated: It is an internal mind, and it is asserted to exist substantially.ğŸ”½The moon is not the object of the cognition of form.

original: gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin no zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod de /
translated: This is a faulty proof because the property of the subject is not established.ğŸ”½How is it that the appearance of two moons is an internal mind?

original: ji ltar na zla ba gnyis su snang ba nang gi sems yin no zhes bya ba de khyed cag rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag sems dang sems las byung ba dag rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i zla ba gnyis su snang ba blo yin no
analyzed: ji ltar na zla ba gnyis su snang ba nang gi sems yin no zhes bya ba de khyed cag rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag sems dang sems las byung ba dag rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i zla ba gnyis su snang ba blo yin no
translated: You Proponents of Consciousness who assert that mind and mental factors exist substantially say that the appearance of two moons is an awareness.

original: zhes bya ba de rdzas su yod pa ma yin par ma grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa'i chos rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma tshang ba nyid kyi
analyzed: zhes bya ba de rdzas su yod pa ma yin par ma grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa'i chos rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma tshang ba nyid kyi
translated: Because it is not established that the meaning of â€œnot substantially existentâ€ does not exist substantially, your example, â€œlike the appearance of two moons,â€ is flawed because the predicate of the probandum, â€œnot substantially existent,â€ is incomplete.

original: skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Because of that, it is not suitable.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i don gyis stong par ston na ni dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod de /ğŸ”½zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i blo phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ma ltos par skye bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar khyed na re ji ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i don gyis stong par ston na ni dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod de / zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i blo phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ma ltos par skye bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar khyed na re ji ste 'dus pa yin na ni de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin te /
translated: If you teach that the consciousness of form is empty of the meaning of â€œform,â€ then the example is flawed because the predicate of the probandum is incomplete.ğŸ”½Because it is not established that the mind that sees two moons does not arise in dependence on an external focal object.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su mthong ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa des gal te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na zla ba gnyis su mthong ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa des gal te /
translated: Previously you said, â€œIf it is a composite, it is not the object of the cognition of form because it does not substantially exist, like, for example, seeing two moons.â€

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i don gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i don gyis stong ste /
translated: The consciousness of form is empty of the meaning of the term â€œform.â€

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la yul phyi rol gyi gzugs med do zhes bya bar ston na ni de ltar na khyed kyi dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la yul phyi rol gyi gzugs med do zhes bya bar ston na ni de ltar na khyed kyi dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod de /
translated: If you are teaching that external form does not exist as an object of the eye consciousness, then in that case, your example has the fault of not fulfilling the meaning of the probandum.

original: ji ltar zhe na /ğŸ”½mig gi rnam par shes pa zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i blo ni de'i yul gyi phyi rol na zla ba bzhi po snga na yod pa de la dmigs nas de'i 'og tu zla ba gnyis pa mthong pa'i blo skye ba yin pas zla ba gnyis su mthong
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / mig gi rnam par shes pa zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i blo ni de'i yul gyi phyi rol na zla ba bzhi po snga na yod pa de la dmigs nas de'i 'og tu zla ba gnyis pa mthong pa'i blo skye ba yin pas zla ba gnyis su mthong
translated: How is that?ğŸ”½The mind that sees two moons is the mind that observes the four moons that exist previously as its external object.ğŸ”½The mind that sees a second moon arises after that.ğŸ”½Therefore, the mind that sees two moons does not arise without depending on the four moons that exist previously as its external object of observation.

original: ba'i blo de phyi rol gyi dmigs pa zla ba bzhi po snga na yod pa la ma ltos par skye ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ltos te /
analyzed: ba'i blo de phyi rol gyi dmigs pa zla ba bzhi po snga na yod pa la ma ltos par skye ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ltos te /
translated: Therefore, your example, the mind that sees two moons, depends on the external object of observation.

original: skyes pa de la bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ma ltos par skye ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: skyes pa de la bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la ma ltos par skye ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The statement that the object to be established is the arising of consciousness of form without depending on an external object is not correct because it is incomplete.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i don gyis ston par ston pa de ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs zhes bya ba'i don gyis ston par ston pa de ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: The statement that the consciousness of form is the appearance of form is incomplete because it is faulty.

original: gzhan yang smra bar 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i gzugs su snang ba nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang smra bar 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i gzugs su snang ba nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the consciousness that is asserted does not possess the appearance of form that is the objective condition of the consciousness of form,

original: mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid du snang ba bzhin @296b pas ;
analyzed: mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid du snang ba bzhin @296b pas ;
translated: because it possesses the cause of eye consciousness, like the appearance of form itself.

original: tha snyad du dmigs pa'i rkyen la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes bya bas ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: tha snyad du dmigs pa'i rkyen la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes bya bas ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: The statement â€œbecause it contradicts the conclusion of the treatiseâ€ means that it contradicts the conclusion of the treatise because it repudiates the objective condition conventionally.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smras pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las phyi rol gyi don ni med kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smras pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las phyi rol gyi don ni med kyi /
translated: The philosophical tenet of those who advocate consciousness only is that external objects do not exist.

original: nang gi sems ni yod pas rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba ni gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha gnyis su skye ste /
analyzed: nang gi sems ni yod pas rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba ni gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha gnyis su skye ste /
translated: Since the internal mind exists, consciousness arises in two parts: the appearance of the aspect of the object and the appearance of the aspect of the subject.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa nyid yul gyi rnam pa lta bur phyi rol na dmigs pa'i rkyen du snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa nyid yul gyi rnam pa lta bur phyi rol na dmigs pa'i rkyen du snang ba yin la /
translated: The appearance of the aspect of the object is consciousness itself appearing as the aspect of the object, appearing as the objective condition that is observed as external.ğŸ”½The appearance of the aspect of the subject is that consciousness itself, in dependence on the appearance of the aspect of the object, arises as the entity of the subject.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa de nyid gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba de la brten nas 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du skye ba yin pas rnam par shes pa nyid las cha gcig ni gzung ba'i rnam par snang /ğŸ”½cha gcig ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa de nyid gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba de la brten nas 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du skye ba yin pas rnam par shes pa nyid las cha gcig ni gzung ba'i rnam par snang /ğŸ”½cha gcig ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ste /
translated: Therefore, one part of consciousness appears as the aspect of the object and one part appears as the aspect of the subject.

original: de gnyis ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid gnyis su dbyer med pas /
analyzed: de gnyis ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid gnyis su dbyer med pas /
translated: Because those two are of the same nature, the two aspects of apprehendeds and apprehenders are undifferentiable.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir sems nyid la sems nyid dmigs te /ğŸ”½skye bas phyi rol gyi yul ni med kyi /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir sems nyid la sems nyid dmigs te / skye bas phyi rol gyi yul ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, mind itself is the objective condition of mind itself, which appears as the aspect of the apprehender, because it appears as the aspect of the apprehended.

original: nang gi sems 'ba' zhig yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nang gi sems 'ba' zhig yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, external objects do not exist, but internal mind alone exists.

original: da 'dir de dag gi gzhung dgag cing rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul nyid yod par ston te /
analyzed: da 'dir de dag gi gzhung dgag cing rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul nyid yod par ston te /
translated: Here, the texts of those are refuted and the existence of external objects as the objective condition that is other than consciousness is taught.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag gis brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag gis brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of the apprehender that appears in the consciousness imputed by Proponents of Consciousness is not endowed with the aspect of the apprehended that appears as the objective condition.

original: mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid gang yin pa de dmigs pa'i rkyen rang gi bdag nyid de nyid dang ldan pa ma yin pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid gang yin pa de dmigs pa'i rkyen rang gi bdag nyid de nyid dang ldan pa ma yin pa bzhin pas /
translated: Because it possesses the cause of the eye, it is like the aspect that appears as the apprehender itself, which does not possess its own nature, the objective condition.ğŸ”½If you propound that external objects do not exist, you deprecate the objective condition even conventionally, and that contradicts the statement in the conclusion of the deeds:

original: phyi rol gyi yul med par smra na tha snyad du yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul med par smra na tha snyad du yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bas /
translated: â€œThe eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.â€

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba kun rdzob tu yang phyi rol gyi yul med par 'dod pa'i gzhung de rigs pa dang lung dang tshad ma thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi rung 'o @297a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba kun rdzob tu yang phyi rol gyi yul med par 'dod pa'i gzhung de rigs pa dang lung dang tshad ma thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi rung 'o @297a * //
translated: Therefore, because the statement that consciousness only is the assertion that external objects do not exist even conventionally contradicts all reasoning, scriptures, and valid knowledge, it is untenable.

original: zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes ston to //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /ğŸ”½dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi rang gi
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi rang gi
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, the example, and the conclusion.ğŸ”½For example, the aspect of the appearance of the apprehended in the eye consciousness is not the eye consciousness that is the cause of the eye consciousness because it is the aspect of the appearance of the apprehended in the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The aspect of the appearance of the apprehended in the eye consciousness is not the eye consciousness that is the cause of the eye consciousness because it is the aspect of the appearance of the apprehended in the eye consciousness.

original: bdag nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan pa ma yin pa bzhin du pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de yang mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen mig gi rnam par
analyzed: bdag nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan pa ma yin pa bzhin du pha rol po dag smra bar 'dod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de yang mig gi rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen mig gi rnam par
translated: The aspect of the appearance of the apprehended in the eye consciousness is not the eye consciousness that is the cause of the eye consciousness because it is the aspect of the appearance of the apprehended in the eye consciousness.

original: shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi gzung ba'i cha gang yin pa de nyid dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba'i cha de nyid kyi gzung ba'i cha gang yin pa de nyid dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The aspect that appears as the apprehending consciousness is not associated with the aspect that is the apprehended object.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul med par gyur na tha snyad du yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la skur pa 'debs pa de'i phyir rang gi mdzad pa'i mtha' las mig dang / gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bas de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul med par gyur na tha snyad du yang dmigs pa'i rkyen la skur pa 'debs pa de'i phyir rang gi mdzad pa'i mtha' las mig dang / gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bas de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, because, as the Proponents of Consciousness assert, there are no external objects, even conventionally, they deprecate the observed condition. Therefore, it is incorrect for them to say that consciousness arises in dependence upon the eyes and forms, as stated in the line â€œEye consciousness arises in dependence upon the eyes and forms.â€

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pa smra ba'i tshul kun rdzob tu dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul rnams la brten nas nang gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba lung dang rigs pas grub pa de nyid nges par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pa smra ba'i tshul kun rdzob tu dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul rnams la brten nas nang gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba lung dang rigs pas grub pa de nyid nges par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Followers of the Middle Way, when speaking in a way that accords with interdependence, will definitely say that inner consciousness arises in dependence upon outer objects. They will say this because it is established by the scriptures and reasonings of the Proponents of Consciousness.

original: gal te 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag 'di skad ces phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i rkyen med kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yul gyi ngo bo nyid du snang ba dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang mi 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga
analyzed: gal te 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag 'di skad ces phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i rkyen med kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yul gyi ngo bo nyid du snang ba dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pas mdzad pa'i mtha' dang mi 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga
translated: Here, the Yogacaras may say: Although external objective conditions do not exist, the foundation consciousness itself appearing as the entity of the object is the objective condition.

original: ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /ğŸ”½rnam par shes pa ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir rgyu yod na lta ba med par mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / rnam par shes pa ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir rgyu yod na lta ba med par mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary here says:ğŸ”½Since consciousness definitely exists by its own nature, it is not tenable that it does not see when there is a cause. Therefore it is not established that it does not have an object.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i rkyen yin na de ni gnas ma gyur gyi bar du rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir rgyu yod na gzugs la lta ba'i rnam par shes pa yang med par mi 'thad pas rgyu kun gzhi rnam par
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i rkyen yin na de ni gnas ma gyur gyi bar du rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir rgyu yod na gzugs la lta ba'i rnam par shes pa yang med par mi 'thad pas rgyu kun gzhi rnam par
translated: If the foundation consciousness is the objective condition, since it definitely exists by its own nature until the foundation is transformed, it is not tenable that the consciousness that sees form does not exist when there is a cause. Therefore the cause, the foundation consciousness,

original: shes pa rtag tu yod pa bzhin du de la dmigs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yang rtag tu skye ba'i rigs dang / de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rtag tu yod pa bzhin du de la dmigs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yang rtag tu skye ba'i rigs dang / de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as consciousness is always present, so it would be logical for the eye consciousness that observes it to arise at all times. But that is not the case.

original: gang @297b gi tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul nye bar gnas na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
analyzed: gang @297b gi tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul nye bar gnas na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
translated: When the objective condition, an external object, is present, eye consciousness arises from the presence of that object.

original: de med na mi skye bas dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de med na mi skye bas dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: But if that object is absent, eye consciousness does not arise. Therefore, without an external object as an objective condition, eye consciousness is not established.

original: ji ste 'di snyam du /ğŸ”½dmigs pa la ni brten byas nas //ğŸ”½mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //ğŸ”½mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
analyzed: ji ste 'di snyam du / dmigs pa la ni brten byas nas // mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye // mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
translated: If you think,ğŸ”½â€œNon-observation arises in dependence on observation,

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: and non-observation arises in dependence on non-observation.â€

original: zhes 'byung bas skyon med do snyam na zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag 'di snyam du rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las dmigs pa zhes bya ba sems tsam du shes pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa zhes bya bağŸ”½yul med par shes pa skye la /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas skyon med do snyam na zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag 'di snyam du rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las dmigs pa zhes bya ba sems tsam du shes pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba yul med par shes pa skye la /
translated: On the basis of that, the non-observation of objects arises.

original: yul med par shes par brten nas gzung ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul med par shes par brten nas gzung ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: On the basis of the non-observation of objects, the nonexistence of apprehended objects arises.ğŸ”½Since that does not exist, the objective condition that is an external object does not exist.

original: de med pas na de yang med cing 'byung ba'i tshul gyis dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul med par 'grub pas skyon med do snyam du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med cing 'byung ba'i tshul gyis dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul med par 'grub pas skyon med do snyam du sems pa yin no //
translated: Since it is established in that way, there is no error.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: phyogs de'i lan ni btab zin te /
analyzed: phyogs de'i lan ni btab zin te /
translated: The response to that position has already been stated.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi skye ba rab tu grub par gyur na ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi skye ba rab tu grub par gyur na ni /
translated: If the mere arising of consciousness were established,

original: de yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then that would be established, but since that is not established, it is said that it is not established.

original: dmigs pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa skye ba dang / mi dmigs pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa skye ba rab tu grub par gyur na ni khyed kyi phyogs de yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa skye ba dang / mi dmigs pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa skye ba rab tu grub par gyur na ni khyed kyi phyogs de yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were established that non-apprehension arises in dependence on apprehension, and that non-apprehension arises in dependence on non-apprehension, then your position would be established.

original: kho bo cag gis don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir khyed kyi phyogs de mi 'grub bo //ğŸ”½de yod par gyur na yang ji ltar rnam par shes pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba de nyid de bzhin du nye bar gnas so zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig pa tsam de yod par gyur na yang sngar kho bos rnam par shes pa ni rang
analyzed: kho bo cag gis don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir khyed kyi phyogs de mi 'grub bo // de yod par gyur na yang ji ltar rnam par shes pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba de nyid de bzhin du nye bar gnas so zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig pa tsam de yod par gyur na yang sngar kho bos rnam par shes pa ni rang
translated: But since we refute ultimate arising, your position is not established.ğŸ”½And if that exists, how could consciousness not exist?ğŸ”½That very statement remains in force.ğŸ”½If that mere representation existed, then the statement I made earlier that consciousness definitely exists by way of its own nature, and that when a cause exists, it is not tenable that seeing does not exist, would remain in force.

original: gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir rgyu yod na lta ba med par mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med par mi 'grub bo zhes bshad pa de nyid de bzhin du nye bar gnas pas dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul med par mi 'grub ces bstan
analyzed: gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir rgyu yod na lta ba med par mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med par mi 'grub bo zhes bshad pa de nyid de bzhin du nye bar gnas pas dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi rol gyi yul med par mi 'grub ces bstan
translated: Thus, since the condition of object does not exist, the non-establishment of the object condition is demonstrated.

analyzed: to // gal te skye ba med pas don med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni de nyid dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i rjes su smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas rgyu yod na lta ba med par mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med par mi 'grub po zhes bshad pa de'i lan du 'dir don dam par skye ba med pas phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa @298a * //
translated: If you say that because of the nonexistence of objects, consciousness does not arise, then you are simply repeating the Madhyamaka position.ğŸ”½If the opponent replies to the Madhyamaka argument that if the cause exists, the view is not tenable,

analyzed: mi skye'o zhes zer na ni de nyid dbu ma pa smra ba'i rjes su smra ba yin pas rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i gzhung nyams so //
translated: then the view is not established without an object, by saying that because of the nonexistence of external objects, consciousness does not arise ultimately because of the nonexistence of arising, then you are simply repeating the Madhyamaka position.ğŸ”½Therefore the position of VijÃ±aptimÄtra is undermined.

translated: Moreover, if one who has taken up the appropriated aggregates wishes to give them up, then it is good to keep oneâ€™s distance from them, as if they were a swamp.ğŸ”½Some YogÄcÄras say that at the stage of first entering into conventional truth, external objects should be refuted and consciousness only should be accepted.

original: phyis don dam pa'i bden pa mngon bar rtogs par bya ba'i dus su ni rnam par shes pa tsam nyid kyang spang bar bya'o zhes zer ba de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i lan yin te /
analyzed: phyis don dam pa'i bden pa mngon bar rtogs par bya ba'i dus su ni rnam par shes pa tsam nyid kyang spang bar bya'o zhes zer ba de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i lan yin te /
translated: Later, when one realizes ultimate truth, consciousness only should be abandoned.

original: dang po kun rdzob kyi bden pa la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rig pa nye bar blang ba yang byas nas phyis don dam pa'i bden pa mngon bar rtogs par bya ba'i dus su gal te rnam par rig pa de yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa
analyzed: dang po kun rdzob kyi bden pa la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rig pa nye bar blang ba yang byas nas phyis don dam pa'i bden pa mngon bar rtogs par bya ba'i dus su gal te rnam par rig pa de yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa
translated: First, when one is engaged in the stage of the relative truth, one accepts the appropriator, consciousness. Later, when one realizes the ultimate truth, one must give up consciousness.

original: ni de theg pa chen po dbu ma pa la 'jug cing bden pa gnyis kyi de kho na gsal bar byed pa'i dri ma yin te /
analyzed: ni de theg pa chen po dbu ma pa la 'jug cing bden pa gnyis kyi de kho na gsal bar byed pa'i dri ma yin te /
translated: If one wishes to do that, then one has entered the MahÄyÄna Madhyamaka and is free of the stains that obscure the reality of the two truths.

analyzed: 'di ltar dper na dang po 'dam rdzab kyi dri mas spags nas /
translated: For example, first one is smeared with the stains of mud.ğŸ”½Later, one washes it off. It is better to keep oneâ€™s distance from the mud in the first place and not get dirty.

analyzed: phyis de 'khru bar byed pa bas dang po nas 'dam rdzab la mi reg par thag bsring ba bzang ba de bzhin du dang po yul 'gog cing rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du khas len la phyis rnam par shes pa tsam de nyid kyang spong bar byed
translated: In the same way, first one refutes objects and accepts mere consciousness. Later, one must abandon mere consciousness as well.

analyzed: pa ni skyed pa dang 'gog pa'i tshul gyis blang ba dang / dor ba'i mtha' la chags pa'i dri mas spags pa yin pas de ltar mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i dri mas spags pa 'khru bar byed pa pas dang po nyid nas mtha' gnyis kyi skyon gyis mi reg par thag bsring ba bzang ba'i phyir slob dpon klu sgrub kyi
translated: Because it is stained by attachment to the extremes of accepting and rejecting through the mode of generating and stopping, it is stained by attachment to the two extremes.ğŸ”½Therefore, since the method of the master NÄgÄrjunağŸ”½is good in that it is distant from the faults of the two extremes from the very beginning, it is good.
