analyzed: zhal snga nas kyis bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'i dbu ma'i tshul bstan pa 'di nyid bzang gi rnal 'byor spyod pa pa kha cig gis blang dor du brtag pa'i tshul da ni mi rung ste ;
translated: The method of the YogÄcÄra is not suitable because it is stained by attachment to the two extremes.ğŸ”½Also, a sÅ«tra says:

original: lung las kyang bcom ldan 'das gang dag chos 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'gag pa 'tshal ba de dag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: lung las kyang bcom ldan 'das gang dag chos 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'gag pa 'tshal ba de dag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma mchis so //
translated: BhagavÄn, those who know that some phenomenon arises or ceases do not have the arising of a buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po las yongs su tshol bar bgyid pa de dag la 'khor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba ma @298b mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po las yongs su tshol bar bgyid pa de dag la 'khor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba ma @298b mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, those who seek nirvana as a thing do not transcend cyclic existence.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad nye bar zhi ba gang lags pa de mya ngan las 'das pa lags pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad nye bar zhi ba gang lags pa de mya ngan las 'das pa lags pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: Blessed One, nirvana is the complete pacification of all signs and the complete pacification of all movement.ğŸ”½The RÄá¹£á¹­rapÄla SÅ«tra also says,

original: rigs kyang / 'di la bsal bya chud zad med //
analyzed: rigs kyang / 'di la bsal bya chud zad med //
translated: Here there is nothing to be removed,

original: bsnan par bya ba ci yang med //ğŸ”½yang dag nyid du yang dag lta //ğŸ”½yang dag mthong na rnam par 'grol //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba ci yang med // yang dag nyid du yang dag lta // yang dag mthong na rnam par 'grol //
translated: and nothing to be added;ğŸ”½see phenomena just as they are,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and when you see correctly, you are liberated.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that point,

original: don ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang bdag med pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa nyid du rtogs par byar rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang bdag med pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa nyid du rtogs par byar rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it says that just as one realizes that objects lack an essence, one should also realize that consciousness lacks a self and is unborn.

original: tha snyad du yang yul dang rnam par shes pa gnyi ga sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yod par shes par byar rung la /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang yul dang rnam par shes pa gnyi ga sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yod par shes par byar rung la /
translated: Conventionally, both objects and consciousness are like illusions and so forth, and it is suitable to understand that ultimately both are essenceless.

original: don dam par yang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid du med pa nyid du shes par byar rung bas tha snyad du yul ni med la rnam par shes pa tsam ni yod do zhes bya ba dang / tha snyad du rnam par shes pa tsam nye bar blang ba byas nas don dam par de yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa de dag gi lugs ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par yang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid du med pa nyid du shes par byar rung bas tha snyad du yul ni med la rnam par shes pa tsam ni yod do zhes bya ba dang / tha snyad du rnam par shes pa tsam nye bar blang ba byas nas don dam par de yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa de dag gi lugs ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the system of those who assert that conventionally objects do not exist and consciousness alone exists and that one should ultimately relinquish consciousness alone is not good.

original: 'dir gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'di skad ces dang por phyi rol gyi don bdag med par bsgoms la /
analyzed: 'dir gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'di skad ces dang por phyi rol gyi don bdag med par bsgoms la /
translated: Here, the Yogacaras might say, â€œFirst one meditates on the selflessness of external objects.

original: rim gyis rnam par shes pa bdag med par bsgoms na yang mjug tu don gcig tu 'du bas skyon med do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: rim gyis rnam par shes pa bdag med par bsgoms na yang mjug tu don gcig tu 'du bas skyon med do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The earlier position is drawn out from within:

original: dang por phyi rol gyi yul gyi yul sgom par byed cing rim gyis rnam par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi yul sgom par byed na ni rim pa kho nas bdag med pa nyid rtogs par 'grub pa'i phyir snga nas cig car du bsgom pa la ser sna bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dang por phyi rol gyi yul gyi yul sgom par byed cing rim gyis rnam par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi yul sgom par byed na ni rim pa kho nas bdag med pa nyid rtogs par 'grub pa'i phyir snga nas cig car du bsgom pa la ser sna bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one meditates on the external object as the object at first, and then meditates on consciousness and gnosis as the object, then it is established that one realizes selflessness in stages. Therefore, it is not necessary to be stingy about meditating on the two simultaneously from the beginning.

original: de lta na blang dor gyi dri ma dang bral ba gnyis las su 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas cig car dbu ma'i tshul khas blang bar bya ba'i rigs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta na blang dor gyi dri ma dang bral ba gnyis las su 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas cig car dbu ma'i tshul khas blang bar bya ba'i rigs so zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, since the fault of being a user of the two, free from the stain of adopting and rejecting, would exist, it is correct to accept the Madhyamaka method from the beginning.

original: de'i phyir de ltar kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang mi mthong bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni brtag pa snga ma gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /ğŸ”½de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang mi mthong bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni brtag pa snga ma gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te / de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
translated: This is the conclusion of the first two analyses.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi @299a * //ğŸ”½ba yin no zhes zer ba de mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi @299a * //ğŸ”½ba yin no zhes zer ba de mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes in this way, the YogÄcÄra assertion that when one does not objectify because the imagined nature does not exist and when one does not see the dependent nature because one does not apprehend it as a sign, at that time all objectification is completely pacified is not established.

original: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin
translated: Now, the YogÄcÄra say, â€œThe so-called consummate nature, the suchness of phenomena, is the absence of nature due to the ultimate absence of nature, and it is the pacification of all objects of observation.ğŸ”½If it ultimately exists, it would be a basis of conceptual consciousnesses and would not be the ultimate.â€

original: te / don dam par yod pa yin na ni zhes zer ba'i gzhung dgag cing brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½des ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: te / don dam par yod pa yin na ni zhes zer ba'i gzhung dgag cing brtag pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin zhes bya ba smras te / des ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gang yin /
translated: To refute that and to teach the third analysis, he says:ğŸ”½Similarly, what is that so-called consummate nature?ğŸ”½This teaches the analysis: What is that so-called consummate nature?

original: de don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni ji lta bu yin zhes brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni ji lta bu yin zhes brtag pa bstan to //
translated: How is it that the so-called consummate nature is the absence of nature due to the ultimate absence of nature?

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon bar ma zhen pa ste
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon bar ma zhen pa ste
translated: yogic practitioners do not cling to the dependent nature as the imagined nature,

original: / gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa rnam par dag pa yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa rnam par dag pa yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the pure, correct pristine wisdom that observes the suchness of dependent phenomena is the consummate nature.

original: dbu ma pas de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is untenable, the root text says:

original: 'o na don dam par chos de rnams nyid ma grub pas de rnams kyi chos nyid kyang mi 'thad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'o na don dam par chos de rnams nyid ma grub pas de rnams kyi chos nyid kyang mi 'thad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: â€œBut if those phenomena do not exist ultimately, their reality will not be tenable.â€

original: don dam par gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams ma grub pas de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams ma grub pas de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since ultimately the other-dependent phenomena are not established, their suchness is also not tenable. This is the meaning of the statement, â€œThe consummate nature also does not exist.â€

original: ji ste tha snyad du rmi lam lta bu'i bdag nyid du skyes pa yod pa rnams don dam par de ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid yin no zhe na ni de ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa kho na
analyzed: ji ste tha snyad du rmi lam lta bu'i bdag nyid du skyes pa yod pa rnams don dam par de ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid yin no zhe na ni de ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa kho na
translated: If you say that conventionally things arise in the manner of a dream, but ultimately they do not exist in that way, and that is the suchness of phenomena, then that suchness is by nature nonarisen.ğŸ”½Since it is established that way, you are just repeating the statements of the MÄdhyamikas.

original: grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i rjes su smra ba nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni de lta na don dam par yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba gtang dgos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i rjes su smra ba nyid yin no zhes bya bas ni de lta na don dam par yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba gtang dgos te /
translated: This is saying that if you say that ultimately the consummate nature exists, then you must give up that position.

original: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni dngos por gyur pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid ni dngos por gyur pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Because that which does not exist is not a thing.

original: ji ste 'di snyam du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste 'di snyam du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the consummate entity is not nonexistent,

original: 'di ltar de ni gnyis su med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gnyis su med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid do /
translated: because it is the characteristic of the nondual thing,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: gnyis dngos dngos po med pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis dngos dngos po med pa yin //
translated: The nondual thing is the nonthing,

original: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the empty thing.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam par med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam par med pa ma yin te /
translated: The YogÄcÄra say: The consummate entity is not ultimately nonexistent,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su med @299b pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su med @299b pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because it exists as the characteristic of the nonduality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.ğŸ”½As it is said in the MadhyÄntavibhÄga:

original: ji skad du dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, we say:ğŸ”½Here, we ask, by what reasoning is it nondual?

original: de la 'dir yang 'thad pa gang gis gnyis med pa yin zhes brtag pa smras so //ğŸ”½gal te / dmigs pa la ni brten byas nas //
analyzed: de la 'dir yang 'thad pa gang gis gnyis med pa yin zhes brtag pa smras so // gal te / dmigs pa la ni brten byas nas //
translated: If you say:ğŸ”½Nonapprehension arises in dependence on apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: and

original: mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
translated: And on the basis of non-apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: non-apprehension arises.

original: zhes bya bas so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re sems tsam du shes pa la brten nas yul med par shes pa skye la yul med par shes pa la brten nas gzung ba med par 'gyur te /ğŸ”½de med pas na de yang med //
analyzed: zhes bya bas so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re sems tsam du shes pa la brten nas yul med par shes pa skye la yul med par shes pa la brten nas gzung ba med par 'gyur te / de med pas na de yang med //
translated: The opponent says: â€œOn the basis of the understanding that it is mind-only, the understanding that objects do not exist arises. On the basis of the understanding that objects do not exist, the non-existence of the apprehended arises.ğŸ”½Because that does not exist, that also does not exist.

original: ces bya ba'i 'thad pas gnyis med pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i 'thad pas gnyis med pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: By this reasoning, there is no duality.â€

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The response to that is stated:

original: phyogs de'i lan ni btab zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyogs de'i lan ni btab zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: â€œThe response to that position has already been stated,â€

original: don dam par skye ba bkag pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don dam par skye ba bkag pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because the ultimate arising has already been refuted.

original: gnyis med pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid las dgag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyis med pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid las dgag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The refutation of the characteristic is twofold:

original: med pa dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dgag pa dang / ma yin par dgag pa'o //
translated: the non-implicative negation and the implicative negation.

original: de la med par dgag pa ni dgag pa gtso che ba ste /
analyzed: de la med par dgag pa ni dgag pa gtso che ba ste /
translated: The non-implicative negation is the primary negation.

original: dper na bram ze med do zhes dgag pas rgyal rigs yod pa mi sgrub par bram ze med par dgag pa nyi tshe tsam zhig ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bram ze med do zhes dgag pas rgyal rigs yod pa mi sgrub par bram ze med par dgag pa nyi tshe tsam zhig ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, by the negation â€œthere is no Brahmin,â€ one does not affirm the existence of a Kshatriya, but only teaches the mere negation of the existence of a Brahmin.

original: ma yin par dgag pa ni sgrub pa gtso che ba ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa ni sgrub pa gtso che ba ste /
translated: Affirming negation is the principal affirmation.

original: dper na bram ze ma yin no zhes dgag pas bram ze ma yin bar dgag pa nyi tshe tsam mi ston par rgyal rigs yin par sgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bram ze ma yin no zhes dgag pas bram ze ma yin bar dgag pa nyi tshe tsam mi ston par rgyal rigs yin par sgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, by the negation â€œhe is not a Brahmin,â€ one does not teach the mere negation of the non-Brahmin, but affirms that he is a Kshatriya.

original: de la 'dir yang gnyis med pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di gal te med par dgag pa'i don yin na ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med do zhes dgag pa nyi tshe tsam zhig bstan par bya'i /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang gnyis med pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di gal te med par dgag pa'i don yin na ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med do zhes dgag pa nyi tshe tsam zhig bstan par bya'i /
translated: Here, too, if this negation called â€œnon-dualâ€ has the meaning of non-affirming negation, then one should teach the mere negation â€œthere is no duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.â€

original: de gnyis med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yod par bsgrub tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yod par bsgrub tu mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to affirm the existence of the characteristic of the entity which is the non-existence of those two.

original: 'on te ma yin par dgag pa'i don yin na ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med pa las gzhan pa med pa'i dngos po yod par sgrub pas med pa yod par sgrub na skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang gzung bar mi rigs pas smra bar 'dod pa'i don 'di la dgag pa gnyi ga'i tshul gyis kyang
analyzed: 'on te ma yin par dgag pa'i don yin na ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med pa las gzhan pa med pa'i dngos po yod par sgrub pas med pa yod par sgrub na skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang gzung bar mi rigs pas smra bar 'dod pa'i don 'di la dgag pa gnyi ga'i tshul gyis kyang
translated: But if it is the meaning of a nonimplicative negation, then since it establishes the existence of a thing that is not other than the nonexistence of the duality of the apprehended and apprehender, if nonexistence is established as existence, then it would be a deprecation.

original: gnyis med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yod do zhes byar mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yod do zhes byar mi rung bar ston to //
translated: Since that is also not acceptable, it is said that in this context of the meaning that is asserted, it is not suitable to say that the characteristic of a thing that is not the duality exists by way of either of the two modes of negation.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½gal te med par dgag pa'i don yin na ni de gnyis med par @300a * //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gal te med par dgag pa'i don yin na ni de gnyis med par @300a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: dgag pa kho nas mthu zad pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa kho nas mthu zad pa yin te /
translated: If it is the meaning of a nonimplicative negation, then it is exhausted by the mere negation of the duality.

original: med pa'i skyon du ma gyur pa ni dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir don dam par med pa ma yin pas 'di ltar gnyis med pa'i dngos po yin no zhes skur pa 'debs pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: med pa'i skyon du ma gyur pa ni dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir don dam par med pa ma yin pas 'di ltar gnyis med pa'i dngos po yin no zhes skur pa 'debs pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the fault of nonexistence does not occur, it is not ultimately nonexistent. Therefore it is not suitable to deprecate it by saying, â€œIt is a thing that is not the duality.â€

original: des ni med par dgag pa'i don yin na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med par dgag pa kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: des ni med par dgag pa'i don yin na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med par dgag pa kho nar zad kyi /
translated: This shows that if the meaning of non-entityness is a non-implicative negation, it is only a non-implicative negation of the duality of apprehended and apprehender.

original: de gnyis med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de gnyis med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since there is no other characteristic of an entity that is the non-existence of those two,

original: gnyis med pa las gzhan pa med pa'i dngos po yin par sgrub cing /
analyzed: gnyis med pa las gzhan pa med pa'i dngos po yin par sgrub cing /
translated: it establishes that there is an entity that is not different from non-duality.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i tshul la yang dag par brten pa nyid legs so zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa med par grub pa'i yon tan dang / khungs dang / mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pa'i smra ba'i tshul la yang dag par brten pa nyid legs so zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa med par grub pa'i yon tan dang / khungs dang / mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is good that you rely on the Madhyamaka system of explanation. This is the praise of the establishment of non-engagement, the source, and the summary.

original: ji ste 'di snyam du dper na thag pa bsdogs pa la sprul du 'du shes pas thag pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs na sprul gyi 'jigs pa nye bar zhi ba bzhin du de bzhin nyid mthong bas nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la
analyzed: ji ste 'di snyam du dper na thag pa bsdogs pa la sprul du 'du shes pas thag pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs na sprul gyi 'jigs pa nye bar zhi ba bzhin du de bzhin nyid mthong bas nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings la
translated: But if you think that just as the fear of a snake is eliminated when one realizes the nature of a rope that one imagined to be a snake, so afflictions are eliminated by seeing suchness, then the dharmadhatuğŸ”½is an object of observation of that wisdom.

original: dmigs par bya ba kho na yin no snyam na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid la dmigs par bya ba rigs pas sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba kho na yin no snyam na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid la dmigs par bya ba rigs pas sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a statement by the opponent that it is logical to establish that the dharmadhatu is an object of observation of correct wisdom that sees suchness.

original: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is illogical,ğŸ”½it says:

original: ji ltar thag pa bsdogs pa la sprul gyi blo skyes na log par shes pa'i phyir 'jigs pa skye'i /
analyzed: ji ltar thag pa bsdogs pa la sprul gyi blo skyes na log par shes pa'i phyir 'jigs pa skye'i /
translated: When the mind arises thinking that a coiled rope is a snake, fear arises because it is a mistaken consciousness.

original: de'i blo ma skyes na yang dag par shes pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa dang / skyon cha mi mnyam pa skyes na nang du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i blo ma skyes na yang dag par shes pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa dang / skyon cha mi mnyam pa skyes na nang du 'gyur gyi /
translated: When that mind does not arise, there is no fear because it is a correct consciousness.

original: de ma skyes na sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ba bzhin pas de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes skye bar 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ma skyes na sdug bsngal med par 'gyur ba bzhin pas de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes skye bar 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since suffering would not exist if that did not arise, it is said that one should not wish for the arising of the wisdom that focuses on suchness.

original: des ni dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa'i lam bsgom pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa'i lam bsgom pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: Thus, he has taught the mode of cultivating the path of non-abiding through the mode of non-apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½dngos po rnams rnam pa thams @302a * //ğŸ”½cad du yongs su ma grub pa ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir / dngos po rnams rnam pa thams @302a * // cad du yongs su ma grub pa ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid yin la /
translated: In order to teach the logic of that, he says:ğŸ”½The suchness of things is that they are not established in any way.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du yang yul gyi dngos por nye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du yang yul gyi dngos por nye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that is not an object in any way, it is illogical that it is apprehended.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / rtag pa dang ; chad pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / don gcig pa dang / tha dad pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma grub pa de ni de kho na yin la de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / rtag pa dang ; chad pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / don gcig pa dang / tha dad pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma grub pa de ni de kho na yin la de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: That is the way things really are, and it is the wisdom of meditative equipoise.

original: de de bzhin nyid kyi 'jug pa'i tshul du brtags pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du yang yul gyi dngos por nye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs te /

analyzed: shes bya dang de kho na dang spyod yul dang ye shes skye ba med pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes a buddha by comprehending the dharmadhatu through the non-arising of objects of knowledge, reality, the experiential object, and wisdom.

original: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub ni mngon par rtogs pa med pas rab tu phye ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: As it is said, â€œThe tathagatas are distinguished by their non-realization of enlightenment.â€

original: des ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang de kho na'i yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: des ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang de kho na'i yul can ma yin la /
translated: This means that the gnosis of omniscience is not the subject of that reality,

original: chos rnams kyi de kho na yang dmigs par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas rab tu phye ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de kho na yang dmigs par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas rab tu phye ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: and the reality of phenomena is not an object to be observed. The Buddhas, the Transcendent Conquerors, are distinguished by their comprehension of this equality.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the refutation of the correct gnosis and suchness imagined by the Yogacaras,

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni don dam pa'i spyod yul can yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni don dam pa'i spyod yul can yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that the transcendent wisdom that focuses on thatness is the ultimate object,

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the eye consciousness.

original: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes dmigs pa can ni don dam par shes pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes dmigs pa can ni don dam par shes pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This teaches the inference that proves that the correct wisdom that is the object of observation of the YogÄcÄra is not a consciousness of the ultimate.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i spyod yul can yin par mi rigs pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis @303a * //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i spyod yul can yin par mi rigs pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis @303a * //
translated: For example, because the eye consciousness is a conditioned phenomenon, it is not logical that it is the ultimate object.

original: brtags pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i spyod yul can yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: brtags pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i spyod yul can yin par mi rigs so //
translated: and the gnosis that focuses on the suchness of that investigation is also conditioned, it is illogical that it is the object of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin du de'i dmigs par bya ba de bzhin nyid kyang slu ba'i chos can yin zhing de kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i dmigs par bya ba de bzhin nyid kyang slu ba'i chos can yin zhing de kho na ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the suchness that is its object of observation is a deceptive phenomenon and is not thatness,

original: dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is an object of observation.ğŸ”½For example, it is like form.

original: dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs par bya ba ni slu ba'i chos can yin zhing de kho na ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs par bya ba ni slu ba'i chos can yin zhing de kho na ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This teaches the inference that proves that the suchness that is the object of observation of the YogÄcÄra is a deceptive phenomenon and is not thatness.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na gzugs ni dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos can yin zhing de kho na ma yin pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes de'i dmigs par bya ba de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos can
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos can yin zhing de kho na ma yin pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes de'i dmigs par bya ba de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos can
translated: For example, form is a deceptive phenomenon because it is an object of observation, and it is not reality.

original: yin zhing de kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: yin zhing de kho na ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, suchness, which is the object of observation of that uncontaminated wisdom, is a deceptive phenomenon because it is an object of observation, and it is not reality.

original: ji ste mdo sde las don dam pa ni brtag par mi nus pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ste mdo sde las don dam pa ni brtag par mi nus pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the ultimate is not to be indicated by inference because it is taught in the sÅ«tras that the ultimate cannot be analyzed and is not the domain of sophistry,

original: pha rol po dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma gnyis kyis yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dgag pa bstan pa de la phyir zlog pa'i tshig yin no ;
analyzed: pha rol po dbu ma pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma gnyis kyis yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dgag pa bstan pa de la phyir zlog pa'i tshig yin no ;
translated: this is a response to the two previous inferences of the opponent, the Follower of the Middle Way, that refute uncontaminated wisdom and suchness.

original: / de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: / de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary himself responds to this as follows.

original: lung dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i stobs nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad bkag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'grub pa'i phyir don dam pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin yang de gtso bo ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i stobs nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad bkag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'grub pa'i phyir don dam pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin yang de gtso bo ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Because nonconceptual wisdom is established by the power of inference that accords with scripture, all conceptualization is stopped, therefore, although the ultimate is not the object of inference, it is not that it is not the principal object.

original: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa brtag pa'i sgrub pa gzhan med pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa brtag pa'i sgrub pa gzhan med pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is not logical to say that it is not the principal object because there is no other proof that analyzes the correct and incorrect.

original: 'o bu cag gnyi ga lung la brten par 'dra yang khyed la ni lung dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pas don dam par ston par yang mi nus kyi /
analyzed: 'o bu cag gnyi ga lung la brten par 'dra yang khyed la ni lung dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pas don dam par ston par yang mi nus kyi /
translated: Both of us are alike in that we rely on scripture, but you are not able to teach the ultimate because you do not have inference that accords with scripture.

original: kho bo la ni lung dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pas de'i stobs nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad bkag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes don dam pa pa yang 'grub bo //
analyzed: kho bo la ni lung dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pas de'i stobs nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad bkag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes don dam pa pa yang 'grub bo //
translated: But I do have inference that accords with scripture, and by the power of that, all conceptualization is stopped and nonconceptual wisdom that is ultimate is established.

original: de grub pa'i phyir don dam pa de ni rtog ge pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin yang rjes su dpag pa de gtso bo ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de grub pa'i phyir don dam pa de ni rtog ge pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin yang rjes su dpag pa de gtso bo ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: In order to establish that, although the ultimate is not the object of the reasoning of logicians, it is not the case that reasoning is not the principal means of access to it.

original: tha snyad kyi sgo nas @303b yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i brtag pa'i bsgrub pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na ma gtogs par gzhan med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang bstan dgos pas khyod kyi glan ka de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi sgo nas @303b yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i brtag pa'i bsgrub pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na ma gtogs par gzhan med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang bstan dgos pas khyod kyi glan ka de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the establishment of the correct and incorrect in terms of conventional reality is the domain of reasoning, and since there is nothing other than reality, reasoning must also reveal reality. Therefore your objection is not reasonable.

original: dpyad pa rgyas par ni dbu ma'i snying po 'di kho na la 'jug pa'i skabs nas rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag dang lhan cig byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i gzhung bstan pa dang / rnam par shes pa tsam du smras ba dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par dpyad pa rgyas par ni /

translated: The extensive analysis will be presented in the context of the present work, the Heart of the Middle Way, in conjunction with the YogÄcÄra.

analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol po dag gis rab tu byed pa'i dang por bsgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa 'ba' zhig gzung zhes zer ba'i lan du /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa 'ba' zhig gzung zhes zer ba'i lan du /
translated: why are only ignorance and craving mentioned?â€

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yin na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yin na /
translated: The answer is that although afflicted states such as attachment are causes of formations,

original: ma rig pa gzung ba ni gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½dper na rgyal po rgyal ba dang / dung gi ma 'gro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma rig pa gzung ba ni gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te / dper na rgyal po rgyal ba dang / dung gi ma 'gro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ignorance is mentioned because it is primary.ğŸ”½For example, it is like the saying â€œThe king goes, the conch goes.â€

original: dper na rgyal po dpung dang bcas pa gzhan @307a * //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po dpung dang bcas pa gzhan @307a * //
translated: For example, it is like the saying â€œWhen the king goes, the army goes.

original: gyi yul 'khor las rgyal ba la 'khor dpung rnams kyang yod mod kyi rgyal po gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyal po rgyal lo zhes bya ba dang / srog chags dung zhes bya ba ma smad rnams mtsho la rgyal ba na ma mos thog drangs pa la bu rnams phyir brgyud du phreng ba thabs su 'gro ba na thams cad 'gro ba yin yang ma gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dung gi ma 'gro'o zhes bya
analyzed: gyi yul 'khor las rgyal ba la 'khor dpung rnams kyang yod mod kyi rgyal po gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyal po rgyal lo zhes bya ba dang / srog chags dung zhes bya ba ma smad rnams mtsho la rgyal ba na ma mos thog drangs pa la bu rnams phyir brgyud du phreng ba thabs su 'gro ba na thams cad 'gro ba yin yang ma gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dung gi ma 'gro'o zhes bya
translated: When the mother of the conch leads her young and they all go to the ocean, although all go to the ocean, since the mother is principal, it is said the conch goes.

original: ba de bzhin du 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan yang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ba de bzhin du 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan yang yin mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, although other afflictions such as attachment are causes of formation,

original: ma rig pa gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma rig pa gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes smos so //
translated: since ignorance is principal, it is said formations are conditioned by ignorance.

original: ji ste yang la la 'di snyam du mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni gti mug mi dge ba'i phyir rigs na /
analyzed: ji ste yang la la 'di snyam du mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni gti mug mi dge ba'i phyir rigs na /
translated: But if someone thinks that the cause of unwholesome compositional activity is ignorance, that is reasonable because ignorance is nonvirtuous.ğŸ”½But how can the cause of wholesome compositional activity be ignorance?

original: dge ba'i 'du byed rnams ji ltar snyam na zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag de snyam du dogs pa'i tshig yin no //ğŸ”½de'i lan du /
analyzed: dge ba'i 'du byed rnams ji ltar snyam na zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag de snyam du dogs pa'i tshig yin no // de'i lan du /
translated: This is a statement of the qualm of others.ğŸ”½In response to that, it is said that just as those who wish to experience the bliss of playing with goddesses in the divine palace of those with ignorance engage in virtue, ignorance is the indirect cause of that.

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i lha'i pho brang na lha mo dang rtse ba'i bde ba nyams su myong bar 'dod pas dge ba spyod pa bzhin du ma rig pa yang brgyud pas rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba ni don dam pa'i mi dge ba yin pas der gtogs pa'i dge ba yang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni de mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i lha'i pho brang na lha mo dang rtse ba'i bde ba nyams su myong bar 'dod pas dge ba spyod pa bzhin du ma rig pa yang brgyud pas rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba ni don dam pa'i mi dge ba yin pas der gtogs pa'i dge ba yang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni de mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And since samsara is ultimately nonvirtuous, the virtue that belongs to it is also nonvirtuous. Therefore there is no fault because ignorance is the cause of the formation of that.

original: dge ba'i 'du byed de dag mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyu ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'du byed de dag mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyu ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of the formation of those virtuous formative forces is ignorance.

original: yang srid ces bya ba ni yod pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun 'brel pas yang srid par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang srid ces bya ba ni yod pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun 'brel pas yang srid par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: â€œExistenceâ€ means that which exists, and it is existence because it is the continuity of cause and effect.

original: yang skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni phung po lnga yod pa rang gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun 'brel pas 'gro ba rgyud lnga yang srid par 'gyur ba ni yang srid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni phung po lnga yod pa rang gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun 'brel pas 'gro ba rgyud lnga yang srid par 'gyur ba ni yang srid ces bya ste /
translated: â€œIt is also called rebirthâ€ indicates that the five aggregates that exist are called â€œexistenceâ€ because they are the continuity of cause and effect, and because they are the continuity of the five types of beings.

original: yang skye ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: yang skye ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: â€œIt is also called rebirthâ€ indicates that it is synonymous with rebirth.

original: yang srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa'i don du'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa'i don du'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: â€œFor the sake of existenceâ€ means â€œfor the sake of existence.â€

original: de'i don du 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya bar tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i don du 'du byed rnam pa gsum po dag mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya bar tshig sbyar ro //
translated: â€œFor the sake of that, the three types of formative forces are formedâ€ indicates the connection between the words.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'du byed kyi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'du byed kyi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œthe formation of formationsâ€ indicates the essential nature of the formations.

original: rnam pa gsum po dag ces bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bye brag gis sam /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po dag ces bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bye brag gis sam /
translated: The phrase â€œthe three typesâ€ refers to the distinctions between meritorious, nonmeritorious, and imperturbable.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed kyi bye brag gis so zhes bya bas ni grangs kyis @307b mtshon pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed kyi bye brag gis so zhes bya bas ni grangs kyis @307b mtshon pa'i don bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œthe distinctions of bodily, vocal, and mental formationsâ€ indicates the meaning of the term â€œthreeâ€ in terms of number.

original: mngon par 'du byed gang yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni bsod nams la sogs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag dag go zhes bya bas ni gsum po dag la chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa dgur dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed gang yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni bsod nams la sogs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag dag go zhes bya bas ni gsum po dag la chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa dgur dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œthe formation of the meritorious, etc., in small, medium, and great degreesâ€ indicates the division of the three types into nine divisions in terms of small, medium, and great.

original: las de dag gis 'gro bar 'gro //
analyzed: las de dag gis 'gro bar 'gro //
translated: The phrase â€œone goes to the destinations by means of those actionsâ€ indicates the meaning of the term â€œpathâ€ in terms of the cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'gro bar ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'gro bar ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: This is the migration of those who are destined for merit, destined for demerit, and destined for immobility.

original: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i las de dag gis go rims bzhin du bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i las de dag gis go rims bzhin du bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'gro bar 'gro'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that through the actions of merit, demerit, and immobility, one migrates to the destinies of merit, demerit, and immobility, respectively.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed la 'du byed kyis 'gro ba rnams su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed la 'du byed kyis 'gro ba rnams su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: These passages explain how the formations are formed through the condition of ignorance and how the formations cause migration to the destinies.

original: da ni 'du byed kyis ji ltar 'gro ba rnams su 'gro zhe na /ğŸ”½'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'du byed kyis ji ltar 'gro ba rnams su 'gro zhe na / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, how do the formations cause migration to the destinies?ğŸ”½To explain the condition of the formations for consciousness, it says:

original: 'du byed rkyen can rnam par shes //
analyzed: 'du byed rkyen can rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness with formations as its condition

original: 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: Enters into the destinies.

original: zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dis kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: This also teaches the nature of the statement the condition of formation is consciousness, the sequence, the connection, and so on.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa 'gro ba'i skye gnas rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //ğŸ”½'du byed rkyen can zhes bya ba ni gang la 'du byed kyi rkyen yod pa de ni 'du byed kyi rkyen can de rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'du byed kyi rkyen can
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa 'gro ba'i skye gnas rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // 'du byed rkyen can zhes bya ba ni gang la 'du byed kyi rkyen yod pa de ni 'du byed kyi rkyen can de rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'du byed kyi rkyen can
translated: The consciousness that has the condition of formation connects to the birth destinies.ğŸ”½The statement the condition of formation is consciousness teaches the meaning of the statement the condition of formation is consciousness.

original: gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don yin par bstan to //
translated: The statement the condition of formation is consciousness teaches the meaning of the statement the condition of formation is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement â€œconsciousness is the individual awareness of thingsâ€ indicates the essence of consciousness.

original: 'gro ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i rigs su 'gro ba'i 'gro ba rnams su 'o zhes bya bas ni 'gro ba rgyud drug po dag bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i rigs su 'gro ba'i 'gro ba rnams su 'o zhes bya bas ni 'gro ba rgyud drug po dag bstan to //
translated: The statement â€œin the destiniesâ€ indicates the six destinies.

original: 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bas ni 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa 'gro ba rnams su 'jug cing nyid mtshams sbyor ro zhes bya bar go rims dang mtshams sbyor ro //ğŸ”½'dir ni 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyi rnam par shes pa kho na @308a * //

translated: The statement â€œit occursâ€ indicates that consciousness, conditioned by karmic formations, occurs in the destinies and links with a new rebirth.

analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes kyang nges par gzung bar mi bya la zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Here, the statement â€œconsciousness occursâ€ should not be taken to mean that consciousness, conditioned by karmic formations,ğŸ”½is the only factor that occurs.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyang 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa la 'du byed yod kyang yang srid par nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang / srid pa la sogs pa dag gi rkyen yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes nges par mi gzung ba'i dgos pa go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyang 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa la 'du byed yod kyang yang srid par nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang / srid pa la sogs pa dag gi rkyen yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes nges par mi gzung ba'i dgos pa go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because mental factors arise from mind, because even though arhats have formations, they do not link to a new existence, and because the conditions for existence and so on exist.

original: 'o na ji ltar nges par gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar nges par gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: How then should it be ascertained?

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyis rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba rnams dang bcas pa dgra bcom pa'i rgyud du ma gtogs pa sred pa la sogs pa dag gi rkyen dang yang ldan pa 'gro ba'i skye gnas rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen can gyis rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba rnams dang bcas pa dgra bcom pa'i rgyud du ma gtogs pa sred pa la sogs pa dag gi rkyen dang yang ldan pa 'gro ba'i skye gnas rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes
translated: The consciousness that has formations as its condition, which is accompanied by mental factors and not included in the continuum of an arhat, links to rebirth in the abodes of sentient beings and possesses the conditions of craving and so on.

original: bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: 'dir slob dpon rnams kyi blo gros tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon rnams kyi blo gros tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Here the masters have different ideas.

original: kha cig na re bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'gro ba'i yul 'thob bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'gro ba'i yul 'thob bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One obtains the destination by means of the continuum of name and form called intermediate existence.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen can 'gro bar skye ba nyid kyis 'gro ba 'thob bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen can 'gro bar skye ba nyid kyis 'gro ba 'thob bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others say: One obtains the destination by means of consciousness that is the condition for formation.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen can 'gro ba'i skye gnas rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen can 'gro ba'i skye gnas rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, consciousness that is the condition for formation links with birth in the destination.

original: 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams ni bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'gro ba'i yul 'thob po zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams ni bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'gro ba'i yul 'thob po zhes zer te /
translated: Ä€ryas such as the VaibhÄá¹£ikas say: One obtains the destination by means of the continuum of name and form called intermediate existence.

original: gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: When one dies and transmigrates from the form realm,

original: ji ltar gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i khams nyid dang gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na bar mdo'i srid pa med pa de bzhin du gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i khams nyid dang gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na bar mdo'i srid pa med pa de bzhin du gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid
translated: Just as there is no intermediate existence between death in the formless realm and birth in the formless realm or the form realm, so too there is no intermediate existence between death in the form realm and birth in the form realm or the formless realm.ğŸ”½

original: dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na yang bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun med de /
analyzed: dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na yang bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun med de /
translated: Just as there is no intermediate existence between death in the formless realm and birth in the formless realm or the form realm, so too there is no intermediate existence called intermediate existence between death in the form realm and birth in the form realm or the formless realm.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa nas skye ba'i srid par srog chags pad pa'i 'gro sa bzhin du thod rgal du 'gro bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa nas skye ba'i srid par srog chags pad pa'i 'gro sa bzhin du thod rgal du 'gro bar 'dod do //
translated: They assert that the continuum of name and form moves like a snake through a bamboo, from the existence at death to the existence at birth.

original: de la snga ma dag na re sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba ni rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan du 'thob par 'dod de ;
analyzed: de la snga ma dag na re sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba ni rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan du 'thob par 'dod de ;
translated: The former assert that the continuum of form of those who die in the form realm and are born in the form realm is obtained in another place, since it is born in another place through a continuous series.

original: gzugs can yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa yod par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te
analyzed: gzugs can yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa yod par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te
translated: This is the inference of the masters of the sutra school such as the Arya that proves the existence of intermediate existence,

original: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: for they respectively apply the subject, the predicate, the reason and the example.

original: dper na mar me ni gzugs can yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mar me ni gzugs can yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a lamp is asserted to obtain other objects because it is a continuum that engages going, since it arises in other places in a continuous manner.

original: sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba yang gzugs can yin na /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba yang gzugs can yin na /
translated: Likewise, if the continuum of form of those possessing form who die in this world arises in another world,

original: 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'dod pas /
translated: it is asserted that they obtain another world because it is a continuum that engages going, since it arises in other places in a continuous manner.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i khams nyid dang gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i 'chi 'pho ba dang @309a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i khams nyid dang gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i 'chi 'pho ba dang @309a * //
translated: Therefore, when one dies and transmigrates from the formless realm, one is born in the formless realm or the form realm.ğŸ”½

original: skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na ni bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun med la /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na ni bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun med la /
translated: Therefore, between death and rebirth existence in the formless realm, the continuum of name and form called intermediate existence does not exist.

original: gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba'i shi 'phos pa dang skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na ni bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun yod do //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba'i shi 'phos pa dang skye ba'i srid pa dag gi bar na ni bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun yod do //
translated: But between death existence in the form realm and rebirth existence in the form realm, the continuum of name and form called intermediate existence does exist.

original: yang na gzugs la brten pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'chi ba'i yul nas 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gzugs la brten pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'chi ba'i yul nas 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, the continuum of name and form dependent on form moves from the place of death to the place of birth in another world.

original: dper na gson po'i gnas skabs bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa yod par dam bcas pa'i phyogs de nyid kyi sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe gzhan yin te /
analyzed: dper na gson po'i gnas skabs bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa yod par dam bcas pa'i phyogs de nyid kyi sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe gzhan yin te /
translated: This is the proof and example of the position that the master of the sravaka Sarvastivadins and so on assert that intermediate existence exists.

original: dper na gson po'i gnas skabs ni gzugs la brten pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'chi ba'i yul nas 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na gson po'i gnas skabs ni gzugs la brten pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi rgyun gyis 'chi ba'i yul nas 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du skye ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, the state of being alive is the continuum of name and form that is based on form, since it is born in another country from the country of death.

original: rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Since it is born in another country in a continuous manner, it is asserted that another country is obtained.ğŸ”½Similarly, the birth of the continuum of form of sentient beings who die in a form realm is the continuum of name and form that is based on form, since it is born in another country from the country of death.

original: sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs can gyi rgyun skye ba yang gzugs la brten pa'i ming dang gzugs rgyun gyis 'chi ba'i yul nas 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du skye ba'i phyir rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan du 'thob par
analyzed: sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs can gyi rgyun skye ba yang gzugs la brten pa'i ming dang gzugs rgyun gyis 'chi ba'i yul nas 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du skye ba'i phyir rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan du 'thob par
translated: Since it is born in another country in a continuous manner, another country is obtained.

original: 'dod pas de'i phyir gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba la bar mdo'i srid pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas de'i phyir gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba la bar mdo'i srid pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because of desire, one who dies in the form realm and is born in the formless realm or dies in the formless realm and is born in the form realm possesses intermediate existence.

original: phyi ma pa dag na re gzugs can gyi khams su 'chi ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa dag ni srid pa gzhan gyis bar du ma chod de /
analyzed: phyi ma pa dag na re gzugs can gyi khams su 'chi ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa dag ni srid pa gzhan gyis bar du ma chod de /
translated: Later masters say: The death existence and birth existence in the form realm are not obstructed by another existence,ğŸ”½because they possess contaminated states, like the death existence and birth existence in the formless realm.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na gzugs med par 'chi ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun phal chen sde la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa med par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na gzugs med par 'chi ba dang / skye ba'i srid pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun phal chen sde la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa med par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: This is the inference of the masters of the MahÄsÄá¹ƒghika school and so on that proves that intermediate existence does not exist.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical argument and the example, respectively.

original: dper na gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa dang / gzugs can du skye ba'i srid pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir srid pa gzhan gyis bar du mchod pa de bzhin du @309b gzugs can gyi khams nas 'chi ba gzugs can dang /
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa dang / gzugs can du skye ba'i srid pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir srid pa gzhan gyis bar du mchod pa de bzhin du @309b gzugs can gyi khams nas 'chi ba gzugs can dang /
translated: For example, since the intermediate existences of those dying in the formless realm and taking birth in the formless realm and those taking birth in the form realm are contaminated, they are obstructed by other existences.

original: gzugs med par skye ba'i srid pa dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½srid pa gzhan gyis bar du mchod pas de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas /ğŸ”½gzugs med pa nyid dang / gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba la bar mdo'i srid pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs med par skye ba'i srid pa dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir / srid pa gzhan gyis bar du mchod pas de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas / gzugs med pa nyid dang / gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba la bar mdo'i srid pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly, since the intermediate existences of those dying in the form realm and taking birth in the form realm and those taking birth in the formless realm are contaminated,ğŸ”½they are obstructed by other existences.ğŸ”½Therefore, just as those dying in the formless realm and taking birth in the formless realm and those taking birth in the form realm do not have an intermediate existence,

original: gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba dag la yang bar mdo'i srid pa med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs can gyi khams nyid dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba dag la yang bar mdo'i srid pa med do zhes zer te /
translated: so too those dying in the form realm and taking birth in the form realm and those taking birth in the formless realm do not have an intermediate existence.

original: des ni srid pa gzhan gyis bar du mchod pas bar mdo'i srid pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni srid pa gzhan gyis bar du mchod pas bar mdo'i srid pa med par bstan to //
translated: This indicates that there is no intermediate existence since another existence is not posited.

original: yang na lus can rnams kyi 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su lus gang skye ba de ni bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na lus can rnams kyi 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su lus gang skye ba de ni bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin te /
translated: Or, the body that is born immediately after the death existence of embodied beings is not the body of the intermediate existence,ğŸ”½because it is a maturational existence and because it is subsumed by the truth of suffering, like the body of utilization.

original: rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i phyir dper na nye bar spyod pa'i lus bzhin no zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun phal chen sde la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa med par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i phyir dper na nye bar spyod pa'i lus bzhin no zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun phal chen sde la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi bar mdo'i srid pa med par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another inference proving that the MahÄsÄá¹ƒghika masters and so on do not have an intermediate existence.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical proof and the example.

original: dper na da ltar nye bar spyod pa'i lus ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin pa de bzhin du lus can rnams kyi 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su lus gang skye ba de yang rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dper na da ltar nye bar spyod pa'i lus ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin pa de bzhin du lus can rnams kyi 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su lus gang skye ba de yang rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Likewise, the body that arises immediately after the death existence of embodied beings is not a body of intermediate existence because it is karmic maturation and it belongs to the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i phyir dang bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin pas de'i phyir yang bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i phyir dang bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin pas de'i phyir yang bar mdo'i srid pa zhes bya ba med do zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore they say that intermediate existence does not exist.

original: des ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su lus gang skye ba de bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin pas bar mdo'i srid pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su lus gang skye ba de bar mdo'i srid pa'i lus ma yin pas bar mdo'i srid pa med par bstan to //
translated: This indicates that since the body that arises immediately after the death existence is not a body of intermediate existence, intermediate existence does not exist.

original: gzhan yang yid las byung ba'i lus yul gzhan 'thob pas 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun phal chen sde la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid las byung ba'i lus yul gzhan 'thob pas 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun phal chen sde la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis /
translated: Moreover, since the continuum of reincarnating beings is engaged through obtaining a body derived from mind in another place, the existence of intermediate beings is not established because the reason is uncertain.ğŸ”½This is a statement by masters of the MahÄsÄá¹ƒghika school and so on that

original: 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi @310a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi @310a * //
translated: proves that the reason stated by Ä€rya SarvÄstivÄda and other masters,

original: khyad par 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: khyad par 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: because the continuum of reincarnating beings is engaged, is uncertain.ğŸ”½They say: A body derived from mind is said to obtain another place through scripture.

original: de dag na re 'di na lung las yid las byung ba'i lus gzugs can ma yin pa yul gzhan 'thob pa yang 'gro ba'i rgyu na rjes su 'jug par gsungs pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na mar me
analyzed: de dag na re 'di na lung las yid las byung ba'i lus gzugs can ma yin pa yul gzhan 'thob pa yang 'gro ba'i rgyu na rjes su 'jug par gsungs pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na mar me
translated: Since it is said that the continuum of reincarnating beings is engaged through obtaining a body derived from mind in another place, what is the example of the continuum of reincarnating beings being engaged?

original: bzhin du sems can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'gyur ram /ğŸ”½'on te 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na yid las byung ba'i lus yul gzhan 'thob pa bzhin du /
analyzed: bzhin du sems can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba rgyun chags su yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'gyur ram / 'on te 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na yid las byung ba'i lus yul gzhan 'thob pa bzhin du /
translated: Do the minds of sentient beings who die in one place and are born in another place obtain another place through the continuum of form arising continuously in another place?ğŸ”½Or do the minds of sentient beings who die in one place and are born in another place obtain another place through the continuum of form arising in another place without being continuous, like the body of a desire realm god?

original: sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba rgyun chags ma yin par yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: sems can gzugs can gang du 'gag pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi rgyun skye ba rgyun chags ma yin par yul gzhan du skye bas yul gzhan 'thob par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since it is uncertain, it is not established that intermediate existence is a being of the intermediate state.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate another reason for that,ğŸ”½the text says:

original: bar mdo'i srid pa med par yang kha ton dang / mar me dang / rgya dang / me long dang / skad dang / me shel dang / sa bon dang / skyur dag gis phung po'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba mi 'pho bar mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bar mdo'i srid pa med par yang kha ton dang / mar me dang / rgya dang / me long dang / skad dang / me shel dang / sa bon dang / skyur dag gis phung po'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba mi 'pho bar mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: 'thad pa des kyang bar mdo'i srid pa med par grub po zhes zer ro //
