original: gzhan ma yin pa na re gzugs can ma yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs khyad par can yin pa'i phyir snga ma dag la skyon de med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pas rang nyid de slob
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re gzugs can ma yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs khyad par can yin pa'i phyir snga ma dag la skyon de med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pas rang nyid de slob
translated: But the AparÄntakas say that the previous reason is not faulty because it is a specific reason, since the continuum of beings is not interrupted when they are not different.

original: dpon legs ldan byed nyid na re phyi ma pa dag gis snga ma pa dag la yid las byung ba'i lus yul gzhan 'thob pas 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa mi 'grub ste zhes gtan tshigs
analyzed: dpon legs ldan byed nyid na re phyi ma pa dag gis snga ma pa dag la yid las byung ba'i lus yul gzhan 'thob pas 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa mi 'grub ste zhes gtan tshigs
translated: Master BhÄviveka says that the latterâ€™s reason is not established because the formerâ€™s reason is not definite, since the continuum of reincarnating beings is engaged by the mental body obtained from other places.

analyzed: kyi skyon btags pa de snga ma dag gi gtan tshigs de gzugs can yin na 'gro ba'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs khyad par can yin pa'i phyir snga ma pa dag la ma nges pa'i skyon de med do
translated: The fault of the reason that he attributes to the former is that their reason is specific, since if the intermediate existence has form, the continuum of reincarnating beings is engaged, as is the case, for example, with a lamp. Therefore the formerâ€™s reason is not indefinite.

original: zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gzhol bar bya ste /

translated: The phrase â€œthus, consciousness serves as the causal condition for name and formâ€ indicates the order of the sequence and the connection between the members.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œname and formâ€ should not be understood as referring only to those that have consciousness as their causal condition.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œname and formâ€ should not be understood as referring only to those that have consciousness as their causal condition, because ignorance, etc., are also causal conditions for name and form.

translated: The statement â€œone craves the object of feelingâ€ shows that the childish who are not endowed with learning, who do not understand the small taste of the short-lived suffering of change, which is like a drop of honey smeared on the edge of a sword, crave that.

original: kha cig na re sred pa 'phel ba nyid nye bar len pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sred pa 'phel ba nyid nye bar len pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Grasping is the increase of craving.ğŸ”½Others say: It is the effort to obtain enjoyments.

original: gzhan dag na re longs spyod rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa'o zhe'o zhes bya bas ni nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re longs spyod rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa'o zhe'o zhes bya bas ni nye bar len pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows the intrinsic reality of grasping.

original: rnam pa bzhi po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang ; brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid dag go zhes bya bas ni grangs dang ming dang so so'i mtshan nyid bstan te /ğŸ”½de ltar sred pa'i rkyen can gyis nye bar len pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes go rims dang mtshams sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang ; brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid dag go zhes bya bas ni grangs dang ming dang so so'i mtshan nyid bstan te / de ltar sred pa'i rkyen can gyis nye bar len pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes go rims dang mtshams sbyar ro //
translated: The four types are the characteristics of grasping desire, view, morality and asceticism, and the doctrine of self.ğŸ”½Thus, the order and connection are explained.

original: de dag gis ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba bstan to /ğŸ”½// / bam po bdun cu dgu pa /
analyzed: de dag gis ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba bstan to / // / bam po bdun cu dgu pa /
translated: Thus, it is explained that grasping has craving as its condition.ğŸ”½Now, in order to explain existence has grasping as its condition,

original: da ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½nyer len yod na len pa po'i //
analyzed: da ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir / nyer len yod na len pa po'i //
translated: it is said:ğŸ”½If there is grasping, the existence

original: srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: srid pa rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: of the appropriator occurs.

original: 'dis kyang len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba la sogs pa ston to //
translated: This also shows the intrinsic reality of the condition of grasping, the sequence, the connection, and so on.

original: nye bar len pa'i rkyen can gyi srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rkyen can gyi srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The arising of existence with grasping as a condition should be supplied.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi srid pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi srid pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Existence is called the existence of karma.

original: srid par byed pas srid pa'o //
analyzed: srid par byed pas srid pa'o //
translated: It is existence because it causes existence.

original: yang na srid pa ni 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: yang na srid pa ni 'byung ba ste //
translated: Alternatively, existence is origination.

original: 'byung ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Origination and arising are synonyms.

original: srid pa'i rgyu'i las gang yin pa de srid pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu'i las gang yin pa de srid pa ste /
translated: That karma which is the cause of existence is existence.

original: 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags pa'i phyir dper na sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba bde'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags pa'i phyir dper na sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba bde'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: For example, it is like saying, â€œThe arising of the buddhas is happiness,â€ where the effect is figuratively designated as the cause. This is the intrinsic reality of existence.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa'i rkyen can gyi srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes go rims dang mtshams sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa'i rkyen can gyi srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes go rims dang mtshams sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the arising of existence with grasping as a condition shows the sequence and the connection.

original: 'dir yang reg pa la sogs pa dag ni gnyi ga ltar yang nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /ğŸ”½rkyen nyid kyis de dag rkyen can yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag gzhan dag gi rkyen kyang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni reg pa dang sred pa'i bar gyi yan lag rnams ni rkyen can kho na zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang reg pa la sogs pa dag ni gnyi ga ltar yang nges par gzung bar mi bya ste / rkyen nyid kyis de dag rkyen can yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag gzhan dag gi rkyen kyang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni reg pa dang sred pa'i bar gyi yan lag rnams ni rkyen can kho na zhe 'am /
translated: Here, contact and so on are not definitely determined to be both,ğŸ”½because they are conditions and because they are also conditions of others.

original: rkyen kho na zhes nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen kho na zhes nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Contact and so on up to craving are not definitely determined to be only conditions or only that which arises from conditions,

original: de dag gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are both.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa dag ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed ces bya ba dag gi rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bas ni rten cing 'brel @314a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa dag ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed ces bya ba dag gi rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bas ni rten cing 'brel @314a * //
translated: Consciousness and so on, which are included in the present time, arise from the causes called ignorance and formation.

original: par 'byung ba'i yan lag gi bye brag bcu gnyis thub pas gsungs pa de dag las dang nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal rnams su 'dus te /
analyzed: par 'byung ba'i yan lag gi bye brag bcu gnyis thub pas gsungs pa de dag las dang nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal rnams su 'dus te /
translated: The twelve different factors of dependent origination taught by the Muni are included in karma, affliction, and suffering.

original: gsum po dag tu ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: gsum po dag tu ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: The three are included in the three times.

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa gsum po ni nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa gsum po ni nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: The three links of ignorance, craving and grasping are afflictions.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa gnyis ni las yin /
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa gnyis ni las yin /
translated: The two links of formation and becoming are karma.

original: lhag ma ni sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: The remaining ten are suffering.

original: de dag kyang phung po gsum du 'dus te /
analyzed: de dag kyang phung po gsum du 'dus te /
translated: They are also subsumed in three aggregates:

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed gnyis ni 'das pa'i dus su gtogs pa yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed gnyis ni 'das pa'i dus su gtogs pa yin /
translated: the two links of ignorance and formation belong to the past,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa brgyad ni da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa brgyad ni da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa yin /
translated: the eight links from consciousness to feeling belong to the present andğŸ”½the two links of birth and aging and death belong to the future.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs las phung po gsum du bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs las phung po gsum du bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation of how they are subsumed in three times.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa brgyad po dag ni 'das pa'i dus su gtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba yin la ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gtogs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi ni
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa brgyad po dag ni 'das pa'i dus su gtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba yin la ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gtogs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi ni
translated: Birth and aging and death that belong to the future time are the effect of the causes that belong to the present time.

original: da ltar gyi rgyu dag gi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi rgyu dag gi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: de dag gis ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: They explain that this passage teaches that craving is the condition for grasping.

original: da ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, they should explain that existence is the condition for birth.

original: de la re zhig da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa'i nye bar len pa yod na srid pa yod pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la re zhig da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa'i nye bar len pa yod na srid pa yod pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this regard, since existence exists when there is the appropriation that is observed at the end of the present, future birth will occur.

original: de med na de mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med na de mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it does not exist, it will not occur.ğŸ”½To demonstrate this, the root text says:

original: de la gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dam /
analyzed: de la gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dam /
translated: If one sees conditioned states as suffering and so on through relying on a spiritual master, listening to the true Dharma, and properly contemplating it, then one sees conditioned states as the suffering of conditioned states or as unarisen due to the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pas ma skyes par mthong ba de'i tshe na de kho na skyes pas sred par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pas ma skyes par mthong ba de'i tshe na de kho na skyes pas sred par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: At that time, since reality has arisen, craving does not occur.

original: sred pa med na nye bar len par mi byed pas /
analyzed: sred pa med na nye bar len par mi byed pas /
translated: If craving does not exist, one does not take up appropriation.

original: gal te nye bar len med na //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len med na //
translated: If there is no appropriation,

original: grol bar 'gyur te srid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur te srid mi 'gyur //
translated: one is liberated and does not exist.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phung po gsum po la yang da ltar yod pa 'jig na 'bras bu nye bar ston pa yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phung po gsum po la yang da ltar yod pa 'jig na 'bras bu nye bar ston pa yin la /
translated: The three-part dependent origination is also the teaching of the result of the present,

original: yod pa 'jig pa'i sbyor ba yang da ltar gyi dus kho na'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod pa 'jig pa'i sbyor ba yang da ltar gyi dus kho na'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the present time is the time of the application of the destruction of existence.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phung po gsum pa la ma rig pa dang / 'du byed gnyis @314b ni sngon gyi mthar bltas pa yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phung po gsum pa la ma rig pa dang / 'du byed gnyis @314b ni sngon gyi mthar bltas pa yin la /
translated: The three aggregates of dependent origination are the two links of ignorance and formation that focus on the past.

original: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar du brgyad ni /ğŸ”½da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar du brgyad ni / da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa yin /
translated: The eight links from consciousness to existence focus on the present.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i mthar bltas pa yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i mthar bltas pa yin pas /
translated: The two links of birth and aging and death focus on the future.

original: de la da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba dag 'jig cing shi 'phos te /
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba dag 'jig cing shi 'phos te /
translated: Thus the eight links that focus on the present, such as consciousness and so on, are connected to the present and they perish and die.ğŸ”½When they cease, they reveal the future result that is birth.

original: 'gags na ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba nye bar ston pa yin la yod pa 'jig pa'i sbyor ba srid pa zhes bya ba yang da ltar gyi dus kho na na yod pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir de gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa
analyzed: 'gags na ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu skye ba nye bar ston pa yin la yod pa 'jig pa'i sbyor ba srid pa zhes bya ba yang da ltar gyi dus kho na na yod pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir de gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa
translated: The connection of existence that is the connection of the destruction of the present is also the connection of the present alone.ğŸ”½If one relies on a spiritual master, one will understand the meaning of dependent origination and the meaning of the three times.

original: dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pas 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du mthong ba dang / theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pas 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid stong pas ma skyes par mthong ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pas 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du mthong ba dang / theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor pas 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid stong pas ma skyes par mthong ba de'i tshe na /
translated: and listening to the holy Dharma and properly reflecting on it, the yogis of the Sravaka Vehicle see the suffering of conditioned states in terms of the aspects of the suffering of conditioned states such as suffering and the yogis of the Mahayana Vehicle see conditioned states as unarisen because they are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: de kho na shes pa skyes pas sred par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de kho na shes pa skyes pas sred par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: When that is the case, since the knowledge of thatness has arisen, craving does not occur.

original: sred pa med na nye bar len par mi byed pas grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sred pa med na nye bar len par mi byed pas grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: And since craving does not exist, one does not take up the appropriated aggregates and is liberated.

original: yang srid par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang srid par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One does not take birth in samsara.

original: da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa'i nye bar len pa yod na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa'i nye bar len pa yod na /
translated: If the appropriated aggregates of the present life exist,

original: srid pa yod cing srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srid pa yod cing srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: existence exists and it is taught that birth occurs due to the condition of existence.ğŸ”½If the appropriated aggregates exist, existence exists.

original: nye bar len pa yod na srid pa zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa yod na srid pa zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of existence?

original: srid pa de yang phung po lnga /
analyzed: srid pa de yang phung po lnga /
translated: Existence is the five aggregates.

original: 'dir yang phung po lnga'i rgyun la phung po lnga zhes tha snyad gdags pa ste phung po lnga ni srid pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir yang phung po lnga'i rgyun la phung po lnga zhes tha snyad gdags pa ste phung po lnga ni srid pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'i /
translated: Here, the continuum of the five aggregates is designated by the convention â€œfive aggregates.â€ Existence is definitely ascertained to be the five aggregates alone,

original: phung po lnga kho na srid pa'o zhes pa ni nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga kho na srid pa'o zhes pa ni nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: but it is not ascertained that existence is the five aggregates alone,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi srid pa ni phung po bzhi pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi srid pa ni phung po bzhi pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because existence in the formless realm is the four aggregates.

original: da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa'i las kyi srid pa ma 'ongs pa'i phung po lnga'i rgyur gyur pa phung po lnga'i ming can de ni srid pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mthar bltas pa'i las kyi srid pa ma 'ongs pa'i phung po lnga'i rgyur gyur pa phung po lnga'i ming can de ni srid pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is called existence is the name of the five aggregates that is, the five aggregates that are the cause of the future five aggregates, which are the existence that is the karma of the present end of samsara.

original: de yod pas ma 'ongs pa'i mthar bltas pa'i skye ba 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yod pas ma 'ongs pa'i mthar bltas pa'i skye ba 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because it exists, birth that is the future end of samsara arises.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: srid pa las ni skye ba 'byung //
analyzed: srid pa las ni skye ba 'byung //
translated: From existence, birth arises.

original: zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, the word â€œfromâ€ is stated.

original: 'dis kyang srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba ston te /ğŸ”½srid pa'i rkyen can gyi skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dis kyang srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dang go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba ston te / srid pa'i rkyen can gyi skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This also shows the intrinsic reality, sequence, and connection of the statement, â€œBirth occurs with the condition of existence.â€

original: skye ba zhes @315a * //
analyzed: skye ba zhes @315a * //
translated: Birth with the condition of existence will occur.ğŸ”½Birth

original: bya ba ni skye bas na skye ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni skye bas na skye ba ste /
translated: Birth is birth because of being born.

original: phung po rnams ma byung ba las 'byung ba'o zhes bya bas ni skye ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: phung po rnams ma byung ba las 'byung ba'o zhes bya bas ni skye ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: The statement, â€œThe arising of the aggregates from what was notâ€ shows the intrinsic reality of birth.

original: de ltar srid pa'i rkyen can gyi skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes go rims dang mtshams sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar srid pa'i rkyen can gyi skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes go rims dang mtshams sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, birth with the condition of existence will occur shows the sequence and connection.

original: de dag gis ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: These show the statement, â€œBirth occurs with the condition of existence.â€

original: da ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Now, with the condition of birth, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and distress occur.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate that this great mass of suffering arises,

original: rga shi dang ni mya ngan dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rga shi dang ni mya ngan dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, â€œold age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair.â€

original: 'di dag gis kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: These words also indicate the nature of the statement, â€œold age and death have birth as their condition,â€ etc., their sequence, their connection, etc.

original: skye ba'i rkyen can gyi rga shi la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen can gyi rga shi la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that old age and death, etc., arise having birth as their condition.

original: de dag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just these,

original: tha snyad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the claim that this teaching is a mere dry treatise of sophistry,

original: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: we will also establish here the scriptural sources for this teaching.ğŸ”½Thus, the BhagavÄn said:

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med pas ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med pas ;
translated: That which is dependently arisen is non-arisen.

original: de'i phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That is why it is called â€œdependent origination.â€

original: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'gag pa ga la yod de /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'gag pa ga la yod de /
translated: How could that which is non-arisen cease?

original: 'gag pa med par rtogs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½de ltar yid ches @317a * //
analyzed: 'gag pa med par rtogs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te / de ltar yid ches @317a * //
translated: Since one realizes that it is not produced, one realizes that it is not ceased; since one realizes that it is not ceased, one realizes that it is not pure; since one realizes that it is not pure, one realizes that it is not defiled; since one realizes that it is not defiled, one realizes that it is not diminished; since one realizes that it is not diminished, one realizes that it is not increased; since one realizes that it is not increased, one realizes that it is not appropriated; since one realizes that it is not appropriated, one realizes that it is not bound; since one realizes that it is not bound, one realizes that it is not liberated; since one realizes that it is not liberated, one realizes that it is not existent; since one realizes that it is not existent, one realizes that it is not nonexistent; since one realizes that it is not nonexistent, one realizes that it is not eternal; since one realizes that it is not eternal, one realizes that it is not annihilated; since one realizes that it is not annihilated, one realizes that it is not come; since one realizes that it is not come, one realizes that it is not gone; since one realizes that it is not gone, one realizes that it is not arisen; since one realizes that it is not arisen, one realizes that it is not ceased; since one realizes that it is not ceased, one realizes dependent origination.ğŸ”½Thus, the establishment of those scriptures that inspire confidence is the source and the good quality of this teaching of the conventional dependent origination.

original: pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni tha snyad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //ğŸ”½de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang / 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni tha snyad pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin no // de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang / 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The teaching of those scriptures as the very object to be explained by this treatise is the greatness of the master's knowledge and the skill of the commentator.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the twelve factors of existence, called The Examination of the Twelve Factors of Existence, from the Prajfiiipradlpa, a commentary on the Mulamadhyamaka composed by the master Bhavaviveka.

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu drug pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu drug pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the twenty-sixth chapter of the Prajfiiimula composed by the acarya Avalokitavrata is complete.

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in the same way, the twenty-seventh chapter is begun by way of the power of the meaning of the teaching of the view of emptiness through the refutation of the distinctions of the opponents of emptiness.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word power should be seen here as having the meaning of cause of engagement in the thesis and as having the meaning of connection with the text that will follow.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, taking the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis,

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in the same way, the distinctions of the opponents of emptiness are refuted through the power of the meaning of the teaching of the view of emptiness.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po rnams skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pas de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byasğŸ”½nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po rnams skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pas de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Here, the treatise was composed in the same way that the thesis was set forth.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
translated: The words â€œin the same wayâ€ refer to the system set forth earlier.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is our own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The position of the opponent is the position that is incompatible with that.

original: 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: It is as follows.ğŸ”½The opponent asserts that things exist inherently.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The words â€œits distinctionâ€ refer to the opponentâ€™s position that things exist inherently, which is presented as the prior hypothesis.

original: gnas 'di skad ces don dam par nye bar len ba'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gnas 'di skad ces don dam par nye bar len ba'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is the topic: in the ultimate, the five appropriated aggregates exist inherently.

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: Because they are the bases of views.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The twenty-seventh chapter is composed in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du @317b byas nas /ğŸ”½lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du @317b byas nas / lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In consideration of the meaning of the following passage,ğŸ”½the twenty-seventh chapter is composed in order to refute that and in consideration of the meaning of the teaching of emptiness as the view.

original: lta ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: lta ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu bdun pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: The meaning of the following passage from the twenty-seventh chapter, the chapter on the critique of views, is the teaching of emptiness as the view.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what aspects does one attain that result?

original: lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /ğŸ”½stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir /
analyzed: lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la / stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir /
translated: The result of this chapter is the teaching of emptiness as the view.

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: One attains that result by way of the aspects that are the refutations of the specific counter positions to emptiness. Therefore, the author of the commentary first taught the result that is the method and the result that arises from the method in this context of the introduction to the chapter.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he said, â€œThe specific counter positions to emptiness.â€

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say the following:

original: don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the five appropriated aggregates definitely exist by way of their own entities.

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the bases of views.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni lta ba'i gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni lta ba'i gnas ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not a basis of views.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni lta ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni lta ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the basis of views,

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: because it says in the Abhidharma:ğŸ”½The origin of suffering, the basis of views,

original: de ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang // 'jig rten lta gnas srid pa yin //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang // 'jig rten lta gnas srid pa yin //
translated: and the world are existence.

original: zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, through the power of the reason stated, the five appropriated aggregates ultimately exist inherently.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the subject, the example of the dissimilar class, the application of the reason, and the conclusion are to be applied in order.

original: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu med pa gang lta bu'i gnas ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu med pa gang lta bu'i gnas ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, that which does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, is not a basis.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni chos mngon pa las de ni sdug bsngal yang yin /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni chos mngon pa las de ni sdug bsngal yang yin /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are said to be suffering,

original: kun 'byung yang yin /
analyzed: kun 'byung yang yin /
translated: origin,

original: 'jig rten yang yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang yin /
translated: the world,

original: lta ba'i gnas kyang yin /
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas kyang yin /
translated: the basis of views,

original: srid pa yang yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srid pa yang yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: and existence, because they are said to exist ultimately, with intrinsic reality.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas lta ba stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute those specific factors that are incompatible with emptiness, the treatise states the following in order to demonstrate the view of emptiness:

original: de skad ces zer ba'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid gyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary states:

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here it is said...

original: 'dir spyi'i don ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i gnas @318a * //
analyzed: 'dir spyi'i don ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i gnas @318a * //
translated: Here, the general meaning is that the opponent's arguments are based on the view that the five appropriated aggregates are the self.

original: yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir re zhig lta ba ni sngon gyi mtha' yul la dmigs shing gnas pa yin pas lta ba de dag nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir re zhig lta ba ni sngon gyi mtha' yul la dmigs shing gnas pa yin pas lta ba de dag nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i
translated: Since the view is based on the prior limit as its object, the reason â€œbecause the view is based on the prior limit as its objectâ€ is not established.ğŸ”½Therefore, the thesis that the five appropriated aggregates exist essentially in the ultimate sense is not established.

original: gtan tshigs de mi 'grub pas des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de mi 'grub par ston to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de mi 'grub pas des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs don dam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de mi 'grub par ston to //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the root text says, â€œBecause the view is based on the prior limit as its object,â€ and so forth.ğŸ”½In order to demonstrate what the views are that are based on the prior limit, what the characteristics of the views are, what the prior limit is, and how they are based on it, the root text says:

original: de la re zhig sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba dag gang yin pa dang / lta ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' gang yin pa dang / de la brten pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba dag gang yin pa dang / lta ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' gang yin pa dang / de la brten pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The views that in the past I existedğŸ”½Or that in the past I did not exist,

original: 'das pa'i dus na byung zhes dang // ma byung 'jig rten rtag sogs par //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na byung zhes dang // ma byung 'jig rten rtag sogs par //
translated: That the world is permanent, and so forth,ğŸ”½And the view that the world is infinite,

original: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: lta ba gang yin de dag ni //
translated: Are views that are based on the prior limit.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
translated: They are based on the prior limit.

original: bdag 'das pa'i dus ni byung bar gyur ces bya ba dang / byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba dang / byung bar gyur kyang gyur la byung bar ma gyur kyang ma gyur ces bya ba dang / byung bar gyur pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag 'das pa'i dus ni byung bar gyur ces bya ba dang / byung bar ma gyur ces bya ba dang / byung bar gyur kyang gyur la byung bar ma gyur kyang ma gyur ces bya ba dang / byung bar gyur pa yang ma yin /
translated: The views that the self existed in the past, that it did not exist in the past, that it both did and did not exist in the past, that it neither existed nor did it not exist in the past;ğŸ”½the views that the world is eternal, that the world is not eternal, that the world is both eternal and not eternal, that the world is neither eternal nor not eternal;ğŸ”½the views that the TathÄgata exists after death, that he does not exist after death, that he both does and does not exist after death, and that he neither exists nor does not exist after death;ğŸ”½the views that the body and life are the same, or that they are different;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata is annihilated at death;

original: byung bar ma gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten rtag pa dang / 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: byung bar ma gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten rtag pa dang / 'jig rten mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar lta ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin no //
translated: the view that the world is finite, that it is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, or that it is neither finite nor infinite;ğŸ”½the view that the soul and the body are the same;

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba dag dang don tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba dag dang don tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: the view that the soul and the body are different;

original: sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the view that the world is eternal;ğŸ”½the view that the world is not eternal;ğŸ”½the view that the world is both eternal and not eternal;ğŸ”½the view that the world is neither eternal nor not eternal;

original: tshe snga ma ste /
analyzed: tshe snga ma ste /
translated: the view that the TathÄgata exists after death;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata does not exist after death;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata both exists and does not exist after death;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata neither exists nor does not exist after death;ğŸ”½the view that the world is finite;ğŸ”½the view that the world is infinite;

original: da ltar gyi phung po rnams la ltos nas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po rnams la ltos nas /
translated: the view that the world is both finite and infinite;ğŸ”½the view that the world is neither finite nor infinite;ğŸ”½the view that the soul and the body are the same;ğŸ”½the view that the soul and the body are different;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata is annihilated at death;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata is not annihilated at death;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata is both annihilated and not annihilated at death;ğŸ”½the view that the TathÄgata is neither annihilated nor not annihilated at death;ğŸ”½the view that the body is pure;ğŸ”½the view that the body is impure;ğŸ”½the view that the body is both pure and impure;ğŸ”½the view that the body is neither pure nor impure;ğŸ”½the view that the body is happy

original: sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa'i phung po rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa'i phung po rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' yin no //
translated: The aggregates that existed in the past are the prior limit.

original: de la brten pa zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: Because the times are different and because they are generated by different karma, like anything else.

translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.ğŸ”½For example, whatever five aggregates of Maá¹‡á¸a is different from Devadatta is not the five aggregates of Devadatta because they are different in time and because they are generated by different karma.

original: las tha dad pas bskyed pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi da ltar gyi phung po lnga po 'di ma yin pas bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya bar lta ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: las tha dad pas bskyed pa'i phyir lhas byin gyi da ltar gyi phung po lnga po 'di ma yin pas bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya bar lta ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: In the same way, the five aggregates that arose in Devadattaâ€™s previous lives are not the five aggregates of Devadattaâ€™s present life because they are different in time and because they are generated by different karma. Therefore the view that â€œI existed in the pastâ€ is untenable.

original: la la 'di snyam du lus dang dbang po tha dad kyang bdag gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la la 'di snyam du lus dang dbang po tha dad kyang bdag gcig yin pa'i phyir /

translated: then the opponent says, â€œIt is not the case that the five aggregates that arose in previous lives are the five aggregates of the present.

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir dang / las tha dad pas bskyed pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bshad pa de mi rung ste /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir dang / las tha dad pas bskyed pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bshad pa de mi rung ste /
translated: Because they are different in time and because they are generated by different karma, they are like anything else.â€

translated: This is unacceptable because although the body and faculties are different, the self is one.

analyzed: las tha dad pas bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason that the Madhyamaka state, â€œBecause they are different and because they are generated by different karma,â€ is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de lta na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te de lta na yang khyed kyi bdag de kho bos sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar mi rung bas
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de lta na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te de lta na yang khyed kyi bdag de kho bos sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar mi rung bas
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, â€œEven so,â€ but even so, since I have already refuted your self, it is not tenable to say that it is this.

analyzed: kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no // 'dir pha rol po dag na re kho bo cag gis khyed dbu ma pa la yang tha snyad du grags pa'i bdag spyir khas blangs nas de skad smras pas sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bdag de nyid da ltar gyi bdag 'di yin
translated: Therefore my reason is not unestablished.ğŸ”½Here the opponent says, â€œWe say this to you MÄdhyamikas having accepted a self that is generally known in conventional terms. Therefore it is established that the self that existed in previous lives is this very self of the present.â€

original: par 'grub po zhes zer pa'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i len du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gal te bdag spyir khas blangs nas smra na ni //

translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, â€œIf you speak having accepted a self in general,

translated: then the appropriator would be different.â€

original: dus dang las tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dus dang las tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: de lta na yang dus dang las tha dad pa'i phyir ston gyi tshe rabs rnams su gang don dam par @320b ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But even so, because time and action are different, he says that the self is not ultimately accepted as the same in past and future lives.

analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: The self is not ultimately accepted as the same in past and future lives.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the reason, he says:

original: 'di ltar / de ni 'byung dang 'jig pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni 'byung dang 'jig pa yin //
translated: Because it arises and disintegrates.

original: de'i phyir 'byung dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa yang snga ma bzhin du bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa yang snga ma bzhin du bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, because it has the attributes of arising and disintegrating, the appropriated aggregates are not the self, as previously explained.

analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa de ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: The appropriated aggregates are not the self ultimately.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyis la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyis la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because they have the attributes of arising and disintegrating, like external things such as crops.

analyzed: yang gzhan yang nye bar len pa nyid bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, another reason will be taught to demonstrate that the appropriated aggregates are not the self.

original: gzhan yang / nye bar blangs pa ji lta bur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / nye bar blangs pa ji lta bur //
translated: Moreover, how could that appropriated

analyzed: nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur //
translated: Be the appropriator?

analyzed: nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The appropriated and the appropriator are not the same because,

analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis / las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na bud shing dang me bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: as previously explained,ğŸ”½the object and the agent are different, like, for example, fuel and fire.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The subject is the appropriated aggregates. The predicate of the probandum is not the appropriator. The reason is because it is the appropriated. The example is like, for example, fuel.

original: dper na sngar me dang bud shing brtags pa'i skabs su bud shing dang me dag ni las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po dag kyang las
analyzed: dper na sngar me dang bud shing brtags pa'i skabs su bud shing dang me dag ni las dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po dag kyang las
translated: For example, previously in the chapter on fire and fuel, it was shown that fuel and fire are not the same because they are the object and agent of action.

analyzed: dang byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: In the same way, here it is intended that the appropriated and the appropriator are not the same because they are the object and agent of action.

analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag na re de lta na khyed dbu ma pas bdag de nye bar len pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Here the opponent says, â€œIn that case, you Followers of the Middle Way teach that the self is not different from the appropriated aggregates.ğŸ”½You also teach that the self is not the appropriated aggregates themselves. Therefore you teach the extreme of selflessness.â€

original: nye bar len pa nyid kyang ma yin par bstan pas khyed kyis bdag med pa nying kyi mtha' bstan pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid kyang ma yin par bstan pas khyed kyis bdag med pa nying kyi mtha' bstan pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of this commentary, in response to this objection, which is being pulled out from its original context, says:

original: bdag med pa ma yin par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag med pa ma yin par yang mi rigs te /
translated: â€œIt is illogical for the self to be selfless.â€

original: bdag la ltos nas bdag med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag la ltos nas bdag med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because selflessness is established in reliance on the self.

analyzed: de'i phyir bdag yod par ma grub pas bdag med par yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa yin par yang mi rigs par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, since the self is not established as existent, it is also not established as nonexistent. Thus it is illogical to say that selflessness exists.

analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag na re gal te khyed dbu ma pa de ltar nye bar len pa bdag med pa yin par yang mi 'dod na /
translated: Here, the opponent says: If you Followers of the Middle Way do not assert that the appropriated aggregates are the self,

original: 'on de ltar na /
analyzed: 'on de ltar na /
translated: then what is the self?ğŸ”½The root text responds to this by stating the following:

original: nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba @321a * //ğŸ”½de'i lan du /
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba @321a * // de'i lan du /
translated: The appropriator is not the self.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The Commentary explains:

analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par mi 'dod de / 'di ltar / de ni 'byung dang 'jig pa yin //
translated: The appropriator is not asserted to be the self ultimately.

original: zhes bya bas bdag yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bdag yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because the self is refuted in the line â€œIt arises and disintegrates.â€

original: don dam par nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: don dam par nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: The appropriator is not asserted to be the self ultimately.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of arising and disintegrating, like external earth and so on.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag na re /
translated: Here the opponent says:ğŸ”½If you MÄdhyamikas do not accept that the appropriated aggregates are the self ultimately, then the self would be without appropriation.

original: de ltar khyed dbu ma pa don dam par nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par mi 'dod na de lta na bdag ni nye bar len pa med pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa
analyzed: de ltar khyed dbu ma pa don dam par nye bar len pa nyid bdag yin par mi 'dod na de lta na bdag ni nye bar len pa med pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary

original: nyid kyis / gzhan gang yin pa de yang bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: nyid kyis / gzhan gang yin pa de yang bdag ma yin te /
translated: says, â€œThat which is different from the aggregates is not the self.

original: rnam pa de lta bu de tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu de tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is difficult to teach such a self even conventionally.â€

original: nye bar len pa nyid las gzhan gang yin pa nye bar len pa med pa de yang bdag ma yin te ;
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid las gzhan gang yin pa nye bar len pa med pa de yang bdag ma yin te ;
translated: That which is different from the aggregates, which is without appropriation, is not the self.

original: bdag nye bar len pa med pa de lta bu de tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes stan to //
analyzed: bdag nye bar len pa med pa de lta bu de tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes stan to //
translated: Because it is difficult to teach such a self, which is without appropriation, even conventionally.

original: bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan yin par smra ba dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan yin par smra ba dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: For those who say that the self is different from the appropriated aggregates, it is said:ğŸ”½

original: bdag ni nye bar len pa las //
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len pa las //
translated: For those who say that the self is different from the appropriated aggregates, it is said:

original: gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gzhan du 'thad pa nyid ma yin // zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The self is not tenable as differentğŸ”½from the appropriated aggregates.

original: bdag nye bar lan pa las gzhan yin par smra ba dgag pa'i rigs pa gzhan ston to //
analyzed: bdag nye bar lan pa las gzhan yin par smra ba dgag pa'i rigs pa gzhan ston to //
translated: This teaches another reason why the self is not tenable as different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan nyid yin na nye bar len pa med par yang bdag yod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan nyid yin na nye bar len pa med par yang bdag yod par bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, if the self were different from the appropriated aggregates, it would have to exist without appropriation.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it would be different.

original: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½dper na nye bar len pa de las gzhan pa'i bum pa ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa med par yang yod par bya dgos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te / dper na nye bar len pa de las gzhan pa'i bum pa ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa med par yang yod par bya dgos pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, it would be like something else.ğŸ”½For example, a pot that is different from the appropriated aggregates would have to exist without appropriation because it would be different.

original: bdag kyang nye bar len pa las gzhan nyid yin na gzhan yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa med par yang yod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bdag kyang nye bar len pa las gzhan nyid yin na gzhan yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa med par yang yod par bya dgos so //
translated: In the same way, if the self were different from the appropriated aggregates, it would have to exist without appropriation because it would be different.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag na re de bzhin du nye bar len pa med par yang bdag yod par 'dod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag na re de bzhin du nye bar len pa med par yang bdag yod par 'dod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here, the author of the commentary himself presents the following response to the opponentâ€™s earlier statement, â€œIn the same way, we assert that the self exists without appropriation.â€

original: de lta yin na /ğŸ”½gal te gzhan na len med par //ğŸ”½gzung yod rigs na gzung du med //
analyzed: de lta yin na / gal te gzhan na len med par // gzung yod rigs na gzung du med //
translated: If it were different,

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: it would be apprehended without appropriation, but it is not.

original: gal te bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan yin @321b na nye bar len pa med par yang gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa'i phyir nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: gal te bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan yin @321b na nye bar len pa med par yang gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa'i phyir nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin par ston to //
translated: If the self were different from the appropriated aggregates, it would be reasonable for it to be apprehended without appropriation, but because it is not apprehended, it is shown not to be different from the appropriated aggregates.ğŸ”½Thus this shows that the self would be apprehended if it were a quality of the self, but it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar 'dis ni bdag gi chos ni gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni bstan bcos mdzad pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'dis bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni bdag gi chos ni gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni bstan bcos mdzad pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'dis bdag nye bar len pa las gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan
translated: The author of the treatise states in the first half of this verse that the self is not different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: tshigs ni gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs ni gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa yin par bstan to //
translated: If the self were a different object from the appropriated aggregates, it would be apprehended, but it is not.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni bdag ni nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir / de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni bdag ni nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: To demonstrate that very point, he posits an inference:

original: gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na nye bar len pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzung du yod pa'i rigs na gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na nye bar len pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore the inference is this: The self is not different from the appropriated aggregates because if it were a different object, it would be apprehended, like the appropriated aggregates themselves.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

analyzed: kho bos rgyud tha dad pa dang / rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa dag gi gzhan nyid ces bye brag tu ma phye bar spyir gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyud ni 'thad par mi 'gyur ro zhes gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do // gang dag lha yang yin la /

analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod la rag / de dag bkag pas de lta bu ma grub pa'i phyir dang / de dag bzhin du de yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni gang dag bdag ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga ma yin no zhes zer ba dag dgag pa'i phyir 'di bstan te /

original: gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis grub par gyur na ni de gnyis bkag pas de lta bu 'grub par 'dod la rag na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis grub par gyur na ni de gnyis bkag pas de lta bu 'grub par 'dod la rag na /
translated: If permanence and impermanence were both established, then it would be possible to assert that something is established by refuting both of them.

original: de gnyis ma grub pas de yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / de gnyis 'grub pa bstan dka' bzhin du de yang 'grub par bstan dka' bas /
analyzed: de gnyis ma grub pas de yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / de gnyis 'grub pa bstan dka' bzhin du de yang 'grub par bstan dka' bas /
translated: But since those two are not established, it is not possible to establish the self in that way. And since it is difficult to teach the establishment of those two, it is also difficult to teach the establishment of the self in that way.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi bdag ma grub pas bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur ces bya bar lta ba'i gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten rtag ces bya bar lta ba mi 'thad do //

translated: As such, since the self that is the nature of both is not established, the view â€œThe world is permanentâ€ is untenable, because the basis of the view, â€œI existed in the past,â€ is not established.

translated: This is the summary of the demonstration that the four views such as the world is permanent and so on are untenable in terms of the eight views that rely on the prior limit.

original: gal te 'jig rten mtha' yod na //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten mtha' yod na //

original: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu dang mjug ces bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu dang mjug ces bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: â€œEndâ€ is a synonym for â€œlimitâ€ and â€œconclusion.â€

original: mtha' yod ces bya ba ni de la de yod pa de /
analyzed: mtha' yod ces bya ba ni de la de yod pa de /
translated: â€œHaving an endâ€ means that it exists there.

original: sa bon tshig pa bzhin du nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sa bon tshig pa bzhin du nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said that just like a burned seed, there is no linking of the two.

original: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar lta ba'i gzhi las 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya bar lta ba 'di 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar lta ba'i gzhi las 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya bar lta ba 'di 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The view that the world has an end arises from the basis of the view that the self will arise in another future time.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar 'jig rten mtha' yod par rtog na mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu dang mjug zad pa yin pas de yod na sa bon tshig pa bzhin du nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med pas
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar 'jig rten mtha' yod par rtog na mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu dang mjug zad pa yin pas de yod na sa bon tshig pa bzhin du nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med pas
translated: If the world were to end as the opponent asserts, then since an end is a terminus, a conclusion, an exhaustion, if it existed, then just like a burned seed, there would be no linking of the two and the world beyond would not exist.

original: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar lta ba'i gzhi mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar lta ba'i gzhi mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore the basis of the view that the self will arise in another future time would not be established.

original: 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya bar lta ba mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yod ces bya bar lta ba mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Thus it is shown that the view that the world has an end is untenable.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the logic of that, the root text says:

original: de lta na 'jig rten pha rol yod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta na 'jig rten pha rol yod par mi 'thad de /
translated: In that case, it is untenable that there is a world beyond.

original: mtha' yod pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i phung po mtha' ma sngon du btang ba las phung po phyi ma 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtha' yod pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i phung po mtha' ma sngon du btang ba las phung po phyi ma 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it has an end, like the final aggregates of an arhat, the subsequent aggregates would not arise from the prior aggregates.ğŸ”½This is the argument.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten mtha' @326a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten mtha' @326a * //
translated: If the world had an end,

original: yod na // 'jig rten pha rol yod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: yod na // 'jig rten pha rol yod par mi rung ste /
translated: then a world beyond would not be tenable.

original: mtha' yod pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma bzhin du 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas 'jig rten mtha' yod par lta ba mi 'thad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mtha' yod pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma bzhin du 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas 'jig rten mtha' yod par lta ba mi 'thad do zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it has an end, like the final aggregates of an arhat, the error would arise. Therefore the view that the world has an end is untenable.

original: glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don dang de sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don dang de sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the opposite of that statement that has an opportunity and the meaning of the context and the qualities that establish that,ğŸ”½the treatise states:

original: 'jig rten pha rol de yang yod pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol de yang yod pas /
translated: Since a world beyond does exist,

original: 'dis ni phung po snga ma rnams kyi 'bras bu ni phung po phyi ma rnams yin pas /
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po snga ma rnams kyi 'bras bu ni phung po phyi ma rnams yin pas /
translated: This demonstrates that the result of the prior aggregates is the subsequent aggregates.

original: de'i phyogs kyi chos ni de'i 'bras bu yod pa yin par bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs kyi chos ni de'i 'bras bu yod pa yin par bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The property of that is taught to be the existence of its effect.

original: 'jig rten pha rol de yang yod pas 'jig rten mtha' yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni de'i 'bras bu yod pa yin par bstan te /

translated: Since that other world exists, the property of the subject that proves that the world does not have an end is taught to be the existence of its effect.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The inference of that will be explained below.
